446885418844748.description:
Edwartainments & Cambridge Junction proudly present 
Akala

Monday 31st October 2016 
Cambridge Junction, Clifton Way, Cambridge Leisure Park, CB1 7GX, UK
£15.50 (inc. £1.50 cmsn)
www.junction.co.uk/akala
Doors 7pm
Under 14s must be accompanied by an adult
Info & Box office: 01223 511 511

▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀

10 Years of Akala gives one pause for thought – here is an artist that had it in him to keep his fierce independence when it was not fashionable, has performed in over 30 countries, released 6 albums, two books, presented the seminal Life of Rhyme for Channel 4, founded The Hip-Hop Shakespeare Company and has been a tireless voice for education and social justice in the UK and all over the world.

Akala does so much it can be easy to forget that first and foremost he is an amazing musician. This anniversary release reminds us of that and the growth of a talent that has toured the UK and globally, all whilst being largely ignored by mainstream radio for the past decade. Last year alone, Akala headlined 4 sold out shows in London (2 at the Jazz Café, Rich Mix and Village Underground) addressed the Oxford Union and released part 2 of Knowledge is Power. His live show is 90 minutes of relentless tracks, backed by intense and stunning visuals, live drums, a DJ and with no need for a ‘hype man’. 2016’s upcoming tour in October promises to be his biggest yet, with a London show at Koko, UK, US, European and Australian dates also to be announced. Fresh from an East Africa mini tour (Addis, Khartoum & Juba) Akala is ready to take on the world again in 2016.

With part 4 of his legendary Fire In The Booth eagerly anticipated for later this year, an appearance on BBC2 & the RSC’s Shakespeare 400th birthday celebrations collaborating with Nitin Sawney and a reggae documentary on BBC4 to be broadcast in October, 2016 will continue to be a year of solid progress and groundbreaking, pathmaking vision from this artistic polymath.


▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀

TICKETS:

BOOKING ONLINE: www.junction.co.uk/akala

BOOKING IN PERSON:
You can buy or collect your tickets prior to the event from:

THE JUNCTION BOX OFFICE: Cambridge Leisure Park, Clifton Way, Cambridge, CB1 7GX.

BOOKING BY PHONE:
Please call 01223 511 511

(You must bring the card on which the tickets were purchased when you collect your tickets)

⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯⎯
Wir feiern das rockigster Silvester schon im Oktober, denn ab jetzt beginnt die neue Zeitrechnung. Mit dem grünen Rockoko-Bändchen habt ihr ab jetzt freien Eintritt bei jeder Rockoko und zwar ein ganzes Jahr lang. Trinken ist schließlich der kleiner Bruder von Tanzen und das am liebsten zu den großen Rockklassikern und aktuellen Hits aus Rock, Indie und Alternative. Poppig, hiphoppig und metallisch sind dann die anderen 3 Floors.

553302868209789.description:
5 Jahre – Wasser mit Geschmack – 26.08.2017

5. Kapitel: Tieftreiben.

Wagehälse, Pioniere und jede Menge Abenteurer haben 2016 die Stellung in Heubach zum Abschweben gebracht. 

Vor einiger Zeit noch sicher und still schwebend in luftigen Höhen, vom Bass und der Stimmung treibend, befindet sich die Insel mittlerweile auf einem unaufhaltsamen Sturzflug in die Tiefen des Ozeans- zielstrebig in Richtung Meeresgrund.

Mit dem letzten Bass und dem letzten Gast, der die Stellung verlassen hat, ging auch die Energie verloren, die die Stellung zum Schweben brachte.  

Doch was genau ist passiert?  Wie geht es nun weiter? 
Findet es heraus! 

Taucht hinab in eine Welt voller seltsamer und gefährlicher Kreaturen, mysteriösen Formen und eiskalten Strömungen. 

Limitierte „Blindfisch“ Tickets: 15,00€ (zzgl. VVK-Gebühren)

Deine Karte fürs gemeinsame Tieftreiben erhältst du nur Online:   bit.ly/wmgtickets

#WMG17 #tieftreiben #nichtmehrFlywieAdler #deepwieAnglerfisch

Website: www.wmgfestival.de

Facebook: www.facebook.com/wmgfestival

Instagram: bit.ly/instawmgfestival

WMG17 - Tickets: bit.ly/wmgtickets

309285819434288.description:
Acclaimed Iranian playwright Bahram Beyzaie will be discussing his upcoming play Tarabnameh, sponsored by the Iranian Studies Program and the Stanford Festival of Iranian Arts. Bahram Beyzaie is a well-known Iranian critic, researcher, teacher, playwright, stage director, producer, screenwriter and filmmaker (director, producer and editor).

Professor Beyzaie will be discussing the second part of his newest play, Tarabnameh. The play is being performed at De Anza College's Visual and Performing Arts Center on October 21, 22, 23, 28, and 30th. For tickets visit tickets.stanford.edu 

*Lecture is in Farsi
*Lecture is Free and Open to the Public (no tickets or RSVP required)

Part of the Stanford Festival of Iranian Arts

1600229040286849.loc_name: Die 90er MEGA Sause Frankfurt am Main - 12.11 mit Mr.President
1600229040286849.description:
Der Ticketvorverkauf ist ab jetzt eröffnet!
http://www.90er-mega-sause.de/frankfurt/

Am Samstag , den 12.November 2016 geht es erstmals nach Frankfurt mit den besten Hits unserer Jugend! 
Unser gemeinsamer Wandertag führt uns in die schöne Konzert- & Eventlocation – der Union Halle FFM  … Mit über 2 Millionen verkauften Platten ist LAYZEE aka MR.PRESIDENT eine der erfolgreichsten Künstler der 90er Jahre. Am 12.11.2016 werden sie euch eine ihrer größten Hits wie z.B. Coco Jambo, I Give You My Heart, JoJo Action performen und die Union Halle zur Ekstase bringen.
https://vimeo.com/25950860

Wir feierten in den letzten 5 Jahren bereits in den größten Locations Berlins mit Stars wie LaBouche, Lasgo, Culture Beat, Cpt. 1592143624420912.description:
Booking is now live via this link https://booking.nucotravel.com/cambridgemedicsandvets/

To get the ball rolling we are offering some prizes for those who book on early. The first 15 people to sign on to the trip will all get a free pair of MVST sunglasses (the yellow ones). In addition, the first 20 people to sign up will be entered into a raffle. The prizes for this are: one set of "Performance" ski hire, and two pairs of Sun God sunglasses.

This year we'll be going to Les Deux Alpes for the thrifty base price of £399. One of the top ten resorts in Europe for snow and with a thriving nightlife, L2A is the perfect resort for students. 

This trip is for everyone - don't worry if you've never skied before, just joined 4th year or don't know anyone going. You'll meet people on the trip so just sign up!

We'll be leaving on the evening of the last day of placement (16th December) and return to London/Cambridge on Christmas eve. This was the only week that would work for everyone, but don't worry, we'll be back around noon so you can get home in plenty of time for Christmas celebrations!

The trip will be run by NUCO and the MVST committee - Luke, Charlotte, Jake, Alex and Josh.

✦ BOOKING ✦

Booking will open on Saturday 24th September at noon. Just go to this link https://booking.nucotravel.com/cambridgemedicsandvets/.

For the first week, booking will be open only for clinical medics & vets, then after a week (1st October) we will open it up for people to invite guests as well.

✦ DETAILS ✦

Base Price: £399
Dates: Friday 16th December - Saturday 24th December

Includes: 
* Return coach transport *
* 6 nights accommodation *
* 6 Day Lift Pass *
* Full social schedule*
* Special prize competitions - TBA *
* Exclusive "strip-in-the-snow" show from Josh Wade *
* BYOO (Bring Your Own Onesie) *

On the way we will stop at a hypermarket so you can buy food & drink for the week cheaply. On the way back there will be an opportunity to get off the coach in/around London, and we expect to be back around noon.

✦ TRANSPORT ✦

Exact coach times are not yet finalised. We expect to leave Cambridge around 7pm on the 16th, arriving in resort late afternoon on the 17th. Then we will leave resort late afternoon on the 23rd, arriving in London around noon on the 24th, and Cambridge early afternoon.

IF YOU PREFER TO FLY: you will have to book flights yourself but NUCO can arrange return transfer for you from Grenoble Airport to the resort for £40. These would be: Outbound 17-Dec-2016 departing Grenoble 15:00, arriving at resort 17:30. Inbound 24-Dec-2016 departing resort at 06:00, arriving at Grenoble by 09:00 [you would stay an extra night in the resort for no extra charge].

✦ SKI HIRE & LESSONS ✦

- EQUIPMENT ONLY - price ranges from £79 for economy to £119 for excellence.
- BEGINNERS PACKAGE - economy equipment hire + 6 hours of lessons - ski/snowboard £119/£129

✦ STASH ✦

We'll be offering some awesome stash designed by Alex "creative genius" Black and the rest of committee.

✦ REVIEWS ✦

Here are some quotes from people who came last year:

"Only six days of skiing rather than my preferred seven... but still, bloody loved it"
- Jeremy Hunt

"Woke up every day with hella early morning stiffness" 
- Mark Lillicrap

"I pulled so many girls"
- Nathan Hudson-Peacock

"Even more fun than the Wilderness Medicine Society"
- Diana Wood

"Dear Matt Mitchard, this letter is a notification that you are required to attend a Fitness to Practise hearing following your behaviour on MVST 2015."
- The GMC

#########################

EXCITING NEWS!!!
The Stanford Bachata Social and Dance class is BACK!!!

The Stanford Bachata Social is a great way to meet new friends, have fun and learn dancing Bachata, a sensual Latin dance that has grown tremendously in popularity over the last couple of years.

Omid and Ariana, the directors of Bachata Sentimiento Dance Company will be teaching a free Bachata dance class. No partner or experience is necessary. During the class we will be rotating partners so everyone gets to dance with everyone. Everyone is welcome for this class and the party!

So come and join us for a fun and exciting night of Bachata dancing.
8pm-9pm: Bachata dance class
9pm-12pm: Social dance party, where you can practice what you learned in the class.

While there is no cover charge at the door, we are paying the cost to rent the venue. We have a donation box available at the studio and everyone can choose if and how much they would like to donate (we recommend a $5 donation per person).

Feel free to bring your friends and help spread the word by inviting your friends via Facebook!

If you have never seen Bachata dancing before, take a look at this video to get the flavor of it:

/Omid and Ariana

1111409178948944.description:
For this edition of HackHarvard, we're intent on applying a timeline to the hackathon experience.
We want to bring back the old technology that started it all, the classic technology that people still look upon at that inspire them to improve or create amazing products. It's a simple idea, but we want our hackers to take it in all sorts of fantastic ways; whether it's reworking a well-known gadget or creating the next iteration of a common solution, the things that will come out of this hackathon are bound to embody elements of the old and the new.

1050263795066075.loc_name: FM4 Indiekiste mit José González with The String Theory
1050263795066075.description:
███████████████████████

FM4 Indiekiste mit Jose Gonzalez with The String Theory

███████████████████████

In January, 2017, José González and the maverick orchestra The String Theory embark on their second collaborative European tour since their thunderous 2011 success with sold-out shows all over the continent and raving reviews in The Independent, El País, Dagens Nyheter and Hamburger Abendblatt. 

Since the release of his third solo album, ”Vestiges & Claws” in February, 2015, José González has been busy touring and selling out venues in Europe, North America, South America, Australia & New Zealand; including The Opera House in Sydney (twice!), Walt Disney Concert Hall in Los Angeles (twice!), The Beacon Theatre in New York and The Cirkus in Stockholm. 

Even if Vestiges & Claws in a way is a comeback album, González has been far from idle in the seven years since the release of his second solo record, In Our Nature (his debut ”Veneer” was released in 2003 and has to date sold over a million copies). 
Besides making two Junip albums and touring the world both solo and with the band, and with The String Theory in Europe in 2011, González has been involved in the soundtrack for the The Secret Life Of Walter Mitty, he has contributed a brilliant version of ”This is How We Walk On The Moon” for the Red Hot + Arthur Russell charity compilation. His solo version of the Junip track ”Far Away” won  “Best Song in A Game” at the Spike Video Awards and Rolling Stone named Junip’s “In Every Direction” a Top 50 single of 2010.

███████████████████████

138964676526297.loc_name: #FotogrAIFE Corso di Fotografia (6 Lezioni 2 uscite 1 set fotografico)
138964676526297.description:
#FOTOGRAIFE Corso di Fotografia

Ciclo di 6 Lezioni di fotografia più 2 uscite e 1 sessione di scatti in sala pose organizzato da AIFE Associazione Italiana Fotografi Emergenti. L'evento é aperto a tutti. Ogni partecipante riceverá in omaggio la tessera come "Amico di AIFE" e potrá accedere ai vantaggi e alle convenzioni con grandi aziende di fotografia e accessori per la fotografia e stampe fotografiche di qualitá. Nel percorso sono previste anche 2 uscite e 1 sessione di scatti in sala pose del valore di 65 euro!

Obiettivo principale: divertirsi insieme e scoprire come utilizzare nel migliore dei modi il potenziale della macchina fotografica. Da quali elementi è composta la macchina fotografica? Cosa significa fotografare e cosa ci insegnano i grandi della fotografia italiana e internazionale? Come si fotografa a casa e fuori? Come crare una storia fotografica? Come configuro la mia macchina fotografica per i momenti più importanti?

Programma

1° Incontro Conoscere la macchina fotografica

2° Incontro Capire le impostazioni fondamentali

3° Incontro Capire la differenza tra l'occhio e l'obiettivo

Uscita fotografica. Sperimentazione e consigli pratici sul campo (3 ore)

4° Incontro Comporre una fotografia: cosa ci insegnano i grandi fotografi?

Uscita fotografica. Sperimentazione e consigli pratici sul campo (3 ore)

5° Incontro Lettura del portfolio e degli scatti realizzati. Cosa migliorare?

6° Incontro Lo stile fotografico: reportage, paesaggi, ritratti

Fotografia da sala pose: il ritratto e introduzione all'uso del flash con modella (2 ore)

Cena di classe per Consegna attestati e mostra fotografica dei migliori lavori realizzati dai partecipanti

 

FAQ

 

È richiesto un documento di identità o ci sono limiti di età per essere ammessi all'evento?

Porta con te un documento di identità per la compilazione della tessera. Non ci sono limiti d'età massima. Si consiglia comunque un'età non inferiore ai 10 anni.

 

Cosa posso portare e cosa non devo portare all'evento?

Porta la tua macchina fotografica corredata di un obiettivo se hai il manuale della tua fotocamera porta anche quello. Un blocco appunti e una penna. La batteria carica e la card formattata. Una pendrive con qualche fotografia scattata di recente.

 

Dove posso contattare l'organizzatore per qualsiasi domanda?

3395963877 segreteria@myaife.it presidenza@myaife.it

 

Devo portare i biglietti stampati all'evento?

Si. Va bene anche una copia digitale.

 

Il nome sulla registrazione o sul biglietto non corrisponde a quello del partecipante. Ci sono problemi?

Specifica che è un regalo e inviaci il contatto del partecipante pre preparare correttamente il materiale.

Speaker: Jeb Bush, academic visitor, Program on Education Policy and Governance, Harvard Kennedy School; founder, president and chairman, Foundation for Excellence in Education; former governor, Florida

Moderator: Martin West, associate professor of education, HGSE; deputy director, Program on Education Policy and Governance, Harvard Kennedy School

Introduction: James E. Ryan, dean and Charles William Eliot Professor, HGSE

Recent changes in federal policy have put states back in the driver’s seat for ensuring equity and excellence in American education. Drawing on his experience as Florida governor and chairman of the Foundation for Excellence in Education, Governor Bush will address the new opportunities for state leadership on K-12 education policy, what it will take for governors and other state officials to capitalize on those opportunities, and the challenges of maintaining bi-partisan support for education reform in a time of heightened polarization. After brief remarks, Governor Bush will engage in a discussion moderated by Associate Professor Martin West and featuring questions from HGSE faculty members and the audience.

Technology and Governance: Cambridge Baltic Conference 2016 (CBC '16). 

The CBC 2016, co-hosted with the Cambridge Union Society, aims at generating a nexus of ideas that will combine the knowledge, creativity and experience of students, business community, politicians and academics to take lead in the discussions of the current state and the future of technology and governance.

The broad heading of Technology and Governance gives the conference an opportunity to discuss various matters: e-health, fintech, e-governance, talent attraction and modern diasporas, big data and governance, and much more.

The conference will also be a part of the British Estonian Chamber of Commerce’s (BECC) trade mission to the UK. The BECC’s delegation which includes a number of business leaders from Estonia will be taking part in the conference.

1263797550320457.loc_name: Cambridge Corn Exchange: Laura Mvula @Cambridge Jazz Festival
1263797550320457.description:
Cambridge Corn Exchange presents Laura Mvula in association with Cambridge Jazz Festivall

Tickets: £22.25
https://www.cambridgelivetrust.co.uk/cornex/events/laura-mvula

Fresh from the announcement of her second Hyundai Mercury Prize shortlisting for her mesmerising and critically-acclaimed album 'The Dreaming Room', Laura Mvula announces some new UK headline tour dates. Fans can grab tickets 48 hours ahead of the crowd with our presale - it's now on!

"With Sing to the Moon, Laura Mvula set a new standard for 21st century soul. With this follow-up, she's raised that standard higher." MOJO

"Many of her songs seem ready-made for some kind of theatrical adaptation. They’re authentically dramatic, built on the swells of brass and strings and percussion, which might suddenly disappear behind some new peak of melody or meaning sung by Ms. Mvula." The Now York Times

Since catapulting into the limelight with her critically acclaimed debut album, ‘Sing To The Moon’ and touring the world, Laura Mvula is back with a new album 'The Dreaming Room'. Laura’s latest single ‘Overcome’, featuring the legendary Nile Rodgers is taken from the new album ‘The Dreaming Room’, released on the 17th June through RCA Victor (Sony). 

It’s rare to come across an artist with such undeniable uniqueness and music so lyrically poetic that it simply speaks for itself.
 
When your heart is broken down
And your head don’t reach the sky
Take your broken wings and fly
When your head is heavy, low
And the tears they keep falling
Take your broken feet and run
With the world upon your shoulders
Nowhere left to hide
Keep your head up carry on
It ain’t no time to die
Even though we suffer
Come together we pray 
 
Produced By Troy Miller who has worked with the likes of Amy Winehouse, Mark Ronson and Rumer, and co-produced by Laura, ’Overcome’ see’s Laura in a new found light - still reflecting her distinctive signature sound but showing the progres-sion of an artist who has come into her own. 

Having formed a friendship through their love of music and each others work, Laura initially sent Nile the first version of ‘Overcome’ and he loved it so much he asked to add some of his magic to the final version. Combining Nile’s upbeat sounds with Laura’s characteristic thrilling harmonies layered beneath stunning tribal beats may come as a surprise to many, but the final product is a true testa-ment to both artists musical talents and a clear development from Laura’s debut album.  

As one of the most exciting musical talents to come out of the UK, Laura has cer-tainly come along way since writing songs at home on her laptop. Now critically acclaimed, her unique character and musical mind has broken the boundaries of music once again.

► Rap am Mittwoch live ◄

15.03.2017

▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂▂

RAP AM MITTWOCH zieht durchs Land um in Wien zum ersten Mal seine Zelte aufzuschlagen. Da es auch in Österreich eine brodelnde Rap-Szene mit unzähligen talentierten Mcees gibt, ist es für "Die realste Cypher Deutschlands" das perfekte Jagdrevier. Als Plattform, Talentschmiede und Community, verleiht RAP AM MITTWOCH dem Slogan "HOL DIR DEIN FAME" absolute Authentizität.Jeder kann teilnehmen. Egal ob erfahrener Rapper oder völliger Newcomer. 

Der Host und Erfinder von RAP AM MITTWOCH, Ben Salomo, gibt in der Cypher nützliche Tipps, hält gern als Punching-Ball her und hat immer einen lockeren Spruch parat. Wer es schafft, ihn und das Publikum von seinem Talent zu überzeugen, darf spontan an der Battlemania teilnehmen. In einem einzigartigen Konzept aus Freestyle, Texten und Acapella, kann sich der Mcee mit anderen messen und sein Können unter Beweis stellen. Dem Gewinner winken Ruhm und Ehre und obendrein noch Geld!

Seit der Wiederbelebung der Cypher im Jahre 2010, wurden etliche Talente entdeckt und gefördert. Es bildeten sich neue Crews und dabei entstanden viele neue Songs. Zum Beispiel erreichte der über RAP AM MITTWOCH bekannt gewordene Mcee Karate Andi mit seinem Debütalbum den 24. Platz der deutschen Albumcharts. 
Auch Laas Unltd. konnte durch sein BMCL (Battlemania Championleague) Match gegen Drob Dynamic ein furioses Comeback feiern und seine Kritiker zum Schweigen bringen.

Für spezielle Anfragen bzgl. der Battlemania , bitte Mail an rapammittwochtv@gmail.com. Informationen zu Rap Am Mittwoch sind auf www.facebook.com/rapammittwoch und auf www.rapammittwoch.tvzu finden.

1098997256837069.loc_name: Amokläufer und Extremisten mit Bierflaschen bewerfen
1098997256837069.description:
Thomas Salbey hat kein Problem damit, dass sein voller Name genannt wird. "Ich habe keine Angst vor diesem Gesindel", sagt der 57-Jährige und führt ihn auf den Balkon, von dem man einen guten Blick auf das Parkdeck hat.

Salbey ist immer noch wütend. "Ich habe hier gestern Abend mein Feierabendbier getrunken, dann habe ich Schüsse gehört und dann ist mir dieser Vollpfosten mit der Waffe da unten aufgefallen," sagt der Baggerfahrer. "Ich habe sogar versucht, ihn mit der Bierflasche zu treffen, aber sie ist da vorne an der Überführung zum Parkdeck zersplittert."

Salbey holt tief Luft: "Wenn ich eine Knarre gehabt hätte, dann hätte ich nicht mit der Flasche geworfen, sondern ihm gleich einen Kopfschuss gegeben, diesem Vollidioten."

Eigentlich sei die Kanzlerin schuld an den Ereignissen wie im OEZ. "Die Merkel lässt doch jeden ins Land", schimpft Salbey, "die sagt doch immer nur, wir schaffen das, wir schaffen das."

http://www.n24.de/n24/Nachrichten/Panorama/d/8875684/der-mann--der-den-amoklaeufer-vom-balkon-beschimpfte.html

319005978491091.loc_name: CUCCIOLE LASCIATE AL CANILE DA LI' NON SAREBBERO PIU' USCITE.....VIVE..
319005978491091.description:
PALERMO 19/09
Lunedì scorso mi reco al canile municipale di Palermo, per recuperare 2 gattini, di cui una paralizzata, uno zampetta in cancrena dove non sarebbero sopravvissuti.....vedo una signora con queste 2 cucciole, li avevano abbandonate nel loro giardino. ...le accarezzo la signora mi dice che visto quello che c'era al canile di cani, stava facendo richiesta di adozione.
Io recupero i miei cuccioli e vado via....
Ma l'indomani la volontaria mi dice.... le cagnoline non sono state più adottate, quindi dentro al canile rischiano che muoiono di gastroenterite oppure malattie infettive, in quanto troppo piccole .....
Bene io non ho fatto sonni tranquilli,  le cagnoline le ho viste, toccate, coccolate, non potevo prendermi carico, avendo 35 gattini di cui mi occupo, dove i miei sonni non sono più tranquilli per i debiti. ...
Ma per queste creature ho stretto le spalle, e allora eccole qua'.....al momento sono ricoverate, faremo accertamenti e cercheremo adozione. ...
Un ANGELO MERAVIGLIOSO per le cucciole provvederà a i costi della pensione GRAZIE ANGELO. ..le piccole avranno bisogno essere aiutare per compensare costi ricovero e quello che necessitano....

646219418880659.loc_name: Cambridge University International Model United Nations 2016 (CuIMUN XXII): Feeling 22!
646219418880659.description:
We don't know about you... but CUIMUN's feeling 22!

This November, Cambridge will play host once again to a special edition of the oldest university-level Model United Nations conference in the United Kingdom, held in the impressive surroundings of the third oldest university in Europe.

We've learned from experience: and with arguably the most collectively experienced secretariat on the UK circuit hard at work since January, and a world-class chairing team assembled since the beginning of June, we are fully confident that this year's CUIMUN will be the best one yet.

Last year, we welcomed some 450 students from every continent bar one. (Antarctica always escapes us.) Just like our participants, this year's committees will be more numerous and more diverse than ever. With sixteen committees on offer, we have maintained a fair balance between old favourites alongside those committees whose innovativeness and originality make the CUIMUN brand: announcing in particular this year two exciting and unique simulations on the MUN circuit, the Emergency Special Session of the UNGA, and the Joint Regional Cooperation Session of the European Council and African Union.

We will also be offering our signature integrated four-cabinet Historical Crisis, promising another innovative and high-paced take on the original format for which CUIMUN has become rightly famous.

In keeping with our conference theme of 'Achieving Gender Equality', we are additionally proud to announce that we have at present achieved a gender-balanced chairing team across the conference, and that the UN Women committee will be given special pride of place at this year's CUIMUN.

With Study Guides due to be released at the end of the summer, and delegate and press applications still open till September (while spots last), now is the time to apply.

For reasons of general inclusivity and through the generosity of our sponsors, we have been able to ensure that our delegate and social fees have been kept to a historic low (£40 delegate fee, with an optional £30 social or £20 half-social pack), while continuing to improve on the overall quality of the conference. We are thus confident that this year's edition will be only the most affordable but also the best-value international conference on this scale in 2016. For the additional benefit of delegations coming from outside of Europe and wanting to take in two conferences, we have continued our co-ordination with OxiMUN for the second year running, which will be hosted the weekend after CUIMUN.

Not yet convinced? Then check out our socials page. In addition to our secret Friday night social, you will have the privilege on Saturday of dining in some of Cambridge's oldest and most elegant dining halls – yes, just like in Harry Potter. Following this exquisite dinner, you will kick the suits, ties, dresses and heels on your way to an epic club-night. All of this in the beautiful city of Cambridge, home of Europe's third oldest university -- and the architecture’s pretty striking too!

For more info, and where to sign up, visit: http://cuimun.org/

Be sure to sign up for CUIMUN XXII to take part in the longest established and best MUN experience the UK has to offer!

#CUIMUNXXII #Feeling22

On top of all that, we had a ton of fun at those last 2 gigs, so when DS asked us to play Cambridge, we thought it through and decided to go for it and also add a London gig so that we could make a weekend of it.

...but it's mainly about selling those damn t-shirts (they'll be cheap) :-)

Friday 11th November at The Cornerhouse, Cambridge
Saturday 12th November at The Islington (Angel Tube), London

The bill for both nights will be Sink with Spoilers and Werecats.

Flyers and FB Events to follow.
And it's Paul Birthday on the 11th and he felt left out with Ed getting all the attention last time

260979424268490.description:
Since the launch party in February, Sweet Revenge!!! has been quietly building a reputation for its friendly, fun and inclusive atmosphere and a playlist that mixes old and new DIY & indiepop with indie disco floor fillers. We’re excited to announce our first festival - the Cambridge Indiepop All-dayer!

We're bringing some of our favourite DIY and indiepop bands to the Blue Moon on Saturday 12 November 2016. 

The Spook School (http:..www.fb.com/thespookschool) recently headlined the Indietracks festival in Derbyshire and we’re thrilled to be bringing them down from Edinburgh for their first Cambridge show! Their infectious punkish indiepop anthems include lyrics that explore gender, sexuality and identity and ridiculously catchy hooks! 

The self-titled debut from Fortuna Pop favourites Chorusgirl (http://www.chorusgirl.co.uk/) is crammed full of dreamy, guitar-driven pop songs reminiscent of The Cure and 80s and 90s 4AD legends like Lush and The Breeders. If you were lucky enough to catch their wonderful set when they were in town last year, you’ll know why we’re so excited to be bringing them back to the Blue Moon!

Two White Cranes (https://twowhitecranes.bandcamp.com/) is Roxy Brennan who you might have seen singing and playing things as part of Joanna Gruesome, Grubs, Towel and formerly of Trust Fund. As Two White Cranes, Roxy makes beautifully stripped down folk-tinged indiepop with a noisy edge.

Deerful (https://deerful.bandcamp.com/) is the electro pop solo project from multi-instrumentalist Emma Winston. Her recent EPs are filled with perfect pop songs that combine compelling storytelling with synth sounds and electronic beats. Her first album will be released in 2017.

Suggested Friends (https://www.facebook.com/suggestedfriends) are a jangly punkish pop band playing catchy songs about regret and micro-aggressions, featuring members of Wolf Girl and Actual Crimes. Melodic hooks, big choruses, and all the awkward banter you could want.

¡Ay Carmela! (https://www.facebook.com/aycarmelaband)
are a three-piece DIY band from West London who make jagged 90s-inspired indie punk with gorgeous, catchy vocals. Their debut album, Working Weeks, is out at the end of July.

In case you’ve been hiding under a rock, Mammoth Penguins (https://www.facebook.com/MammothPenguins) are Cambridge’s finest Indiepop three-piece! Emma, Mark and Tom have played in a million bands over the past 15 years, including Standard Fare, Pony Collaboration, Violet Woods and Puncture Repair Kit. They’ve built up a great live reputation, had a load of airplay on 6 Music and their debut album Hide and Seek was one of our favourite records of 2015!

Local heroes Baby Seals (https://www.facebook.com/thebabyseals/) have been building up a following in Cambridge over the last year with their noisy live shows and empowering, feminist pop punk songs. We love them!

Melge (https://melge.bandcamp.com/) write cerebral belters for wine nights and Wine Knights. Lovely pointy-punk synth tunes from Cambridge and London.

As we’ll be entertaining you all day, we’ll also be providing some tasty food options! The Blue Moon will be serving its amazing astronaut-themed pizzas all day and the award-winning Wandering Yak will also be setting up outside at tea-time. The Wandering Yak is a Cambridge streetfood truck specialising in meat-free Middle Eastern influenced food. A recent winner of the Cambridge Streetfood award 2016, The Yak will delight with variety, amazing flavours and lots of choice, especially in their Mezze boxes. 

Doors will open around 1.30 pm with bands starting soon after. After the bands finish, we'll be having a Sweet Revenge!!! indie disco until late. Dancing is included in the ticket price!

Advance tickets are available for £12 at We Got Tickets. If we have any tickets left on the day, they’ll be available on the door for £15.

The Cambridge IV is one of the most prestigious and competitive debate tournaments, both within IONA and globally. It has traditionally been characterised by outstanding judging, top-notch debates and superb socials - this year is no exception.

The tournament will take place on 18 and 19 November. International arrivals will be on 17 November.

The team cap has been expanded to 120 teams. Registration fees are £85 and £100 for IONA (the UK and Ireland) and non-IONA teams respectively. N-1 applies for judging, but institutions are welcome to register more judges.

232370690287270.loc_name: ...tanzt in den Mai!! - mit Salsa und anderen Latinorhythmen!!
232370690287270.description:
Die Norddeutsche Latinogemeinde feiert mit ihren deutschen Freunden auch dieses Jahres wieder im La Macumba - The Real Latin Club in Hamburgs City  La Macumba, dem Salsa-Club im Herzen Hamburgs.

30. April - Tanz in den Mai im La Macumba, dem Treffpunkt für alle norddeutschen Latinos, Salseros und solche, die es noch werden möchten.

Die einfallsreichsten Cocktails, die heissesten Latino-Rhythmen und die wohl besten Salsataenzer - zum Fruehlingsanfang die Caribik live erleben im ansonsten kühlen Norden!

Eingeladen sind alle, die Lust an heisser Salsa, an Bachata, Merengue und Reggaeton haben. Um 22:00 Uhr geht es los.


Wer dann genauso tanzen moechte, wie an diesem Abend gesehen, am 30. Mai beginnt die nächste Kursstaffel an der Latin Dance Academy - http://lda.in/index.php?arg=KURSinfo_neu

Und natürlich jedes Wochenende Workshop zu den verschiedensten Themen der cubanischen Tänze. - http://lda.in/index.php?arg=PROGRAMM#ws


Professionelle Trainer - alle mit abgeschlossenem Studium an der ISA - der cubanischen nationalen Kunsthochschule fuer Taenzer, Choreographen und Tanzpaedagogen - bringen auch dem *steifsten* Norddeutschen caribisches Koerperbewusstsein nahe.


Erst einmal aber viel Spass allen, die mit ihren Freunden dabeisein koennen, viel Spass in der langen Nacht von April auf Mai in der Hamburger Innenstadt.

456703734525595.description:
Welcome to the event page for the Cambridge Women's open. 
Cambridge Women's will be 4 rounds of 5 minute speeches with a break to semi-finals. We are also hoping to have a break to ESL and Novice finals depending on how many teams reg.
N-1 applies to all institutional teams. We would ask universities to preference judges who identify wholly or partially as women in selection, however all are welcome. All chair judges will identify wholly or partially as women and the same policy applies to the break. This also applies to independent judges

Schedule: 
9:00-9:30 Registration
9:30-10:00 Announcements
10.00-11.30 Round 1
11.30-13.00 Round 2
13.00-14.00 Lunch 
14.00-15.30 Round 3
15.30-17.00 Round 4
17.00-18:00 Dinner and Break Announcement 
18:00-19.30 Semi-Finals (and possible Novice/ESL Finals)
19.30-21:00 Finals
21.00 Social and Announcements/Awards

CAs: 
Bionda Merckens
Bionda is the convenor of Dutch WUDC 2017. She has been very active on the Dutch and the international circuit, both in judging and debating. At WUDC, she was an open quarter-finalist, an ESL top 10 speaker and breaking judge. Bionda has had similar success at EUDC, she has been an ESL quarterfinalist and an EUDC top 10 ESL speaker.

Gigi Gil 
Gigi has broken at over 25 competitions as a speaker and about 20 as a judge. This includes an ESL semi-final at WUDC 2016 and an ESL quarter-final at EUDC 2016, where she was also 6th best ESL speaker. She also broke as a judge at EUDC 2014. Gigi has won about 5 competitions, including Berlin IV 2016. She has been best speaker 4 times including Paris IV this year. She has already CA'ed over 10 competitions including Imperial IV and Dutch Nationals, and is going to CA KCL and Cork.

Evan Lynyak 
Evan was 7th best speaker at Thessaloniki WUDC and the 5th breaking team. In addition, she was the North American Universities champion and 7th best speaker, the Pan American Universities champion and top speaker and a US Universities Grand Finalist and 2nd speaker. Evan has judged the semifinals of the Yale IV, the open partial quarterfinals and the ESL semifinals at EUDC.

Sharmila Parmanand
Sharmila was CA of Berlin WUDC, Asian BP 2011, Austral-Asian Women's 2012 and US Nationals 2016. She was DCA of Australs in 2010 and 2011. She Judged WUDC Open Finals twice and Open Semifinals thee times. She also spoke in the Grand Final of Australs and WUDC Octofinals and is a three time Asian champion. Sharmila has also coached teams across 25 countries.

Any enquiries should be made to:
Katherine Dunbar and Lydia Day 
Convenors 
cambridgewomensopen@gmail.com

Eligibility: 
Speakers and judges should individually identify wholly or partially as women.

Friday, October 28, at 7 p.m.

320715784946752.loc_name: Illegale Kriege - Vortrag und Buchvorstellung mit Autor Dr. Daniele Ganser
320715784946752.description:
Der Schweizer Friedensforscher und Historiker Dr. Daniele Ganser hält seinen Vortrag "Illegale Kriege"  im Kino Babylon, Rosa-Luxemburg-Str. 30, 10178 Berlin, an den drei folgenden Terminen:

Freitag, den 02.12., Beginn 19.30 Uhr
Sonntag, den 04.12., Beginn 18.30 Uhr
Montag, den 05.12., Beginn 19.30 Uhr

Der Kartenvorverkauf ist eröffnet. Der Eintrittspreis beträgt 14 EUR.

Seit der Gründung der Friedensorganisation UNO 1945 gilt ein weltweites Kriegsverbot. Nur in zwei Ausnahmen sind kriegerische Maßnahmen zugelassen: Selbstverteidigung oder Mandat des UNO-Sicherheitsrats.

Die Realität ist jedoch eine ganz andere. Die Gewaltspirale dreht immer schneller, Terrorangst breitet sich aus, und auch Deutschland beteiligt sich wieder an Kriegen, aktuell in Afghanistan und Syrien.

Dr. Daniele Ganser präsentiert in diesem Vortrag sein neues Buch "Illegale Kriege" und zeigt, wie die NATO-Länder die UNO sabotierten in Libyen, Irak, Afghanistan, Syrien und anderen Konflikten.

Der Vortrag verlangt kein Vorwissen und ist von beklemmender Aktualität. Dr. Ganser verkauft und signiert nach dem Vortrag sein neues Buch.

194915837335966.description:
Liebe Freunde der after 7,
aufgrund anderer Projekte und dem engen Zeitplan der Band und dem Orga-Team, ist es uns nicht möglich das Open Air in diesem Jahr wie geplant durchzuführen. Daher findet in diesem Jahr das Open Air NICHT statt und wir verlegen das Projekt auf 2017 !!!
Wir bitten um euer Verständnis, denn um unserem eigenen Anspruch gerecht zu werden und für euch ein perfektes Open Air auf die Beine zu stellen, ist in diesem Monat leider unser Terminkalender komplett dicht.
Wir freuen uns aber, euch auch im Sommer jeden Donnerstag in der Bar 51 zu begrüßen, wo unsere Band Woche für Woche unvergessliche Abende zelebriert!

Auf ein NEUES in 2017:
Wir laden Euch zum LIVE - Open Air Highlight des Jahres 2017 ein. Neben coolen Drinks und perfektem Sonnenschein wird Euch unsere Band Superstitious in TOP-Besetzung so richtig einheizen!

Unsere Band wird mit allen verfügbaren Musikern auftreten. Ähnlich wie bei unseren jährlichen Jubiläums-Konzerten in der Bar 51, wird die Band in voller Besetzung auftreten und für jede Menge Highlights und Abwechslung sorgen. Einerseits präsentieren die Musiker viele eigene Songs, aber auch bekannte Klassiker, die eure Tanzbeine im Sand keine Ruhe lassen werden!

Die Poller Strandbar ist das Strandparadies auf einem riesengroßen Arreal mit feinem, weißen Sand. Liegestühle, Himmelbetten, Strandkörbe und Loungemöbel bieten bequeme Chillmöglichkeiten. Im Deko-Pool können die Füße abgekühlt werden. Für den kleinnen oder großen Hunger gibt es Riesenhamburger, Putenburger, Sommersalat mit frischen Früchten sowie Brat- und Currywurst - alles frisch vom Grill. Pizza und Flammkuchen gibts auch. Die Himmelbetten können reserviert werden per Mail an: beach(at)after7.de

Vor und nach dem Konzert wird euch DJ FREEZE (Musical Healing) mit House und RnB Klängen verwöhnen.

Location: Poller Strandbar, Alfred-Schütte-Allee 34, 51105 Köln (Poll)

643145875816036.description:
Am Samstag hatten wir unsere fantastische *Tanz in den Mai* Party - am Dienstag kommt Manolito y su Trabuco in die Fabrik nach Hamburg - Freikarten gibt es noch hier: fb.com/events/1686999601539357 - und schon am Mittwoch geht es weiter mit Musik aus Cuba und der Caribic und den wohl besten Salseros Norddeutschlands.

Die Norddeutsche Latinogemeinde feiert ihre Väter!! Auch dieses Jahr wieder zusammen mit ihren deutschen Freunden La Macumba, dem Salsa-Club im Herzen Hamburgs.

04. Mai - Tanz in den Vatertag im La Macumba, dem Treffpunkt für alle norddeutschen Latinos, Salseros und solche, die es noch werden möchten.

Die einfallsreichsten Cocktails - Flaschen zu weniger als dem halben Preis - die heißesten Latino-Rhythmen und die wohl besten Salsataenzer - zum Frühlingsanfang die Caribik live erleben im ansonsten kühlen Norden!

Eingeladen sind alle, die Lust an heißer Salsa, an Bachata, Merengue und Reggaeton - Cubaton haben. Um 22:00 Uhr geht es los.


Wer dann genauso tanzen möchte, wie an diesem Abend gesehen, am 30. Mai beginnt die nächste Kursstaffel an der Latin Dance Academy - http://lda.in/index.php?arg=KURSinfo_neu

Und natürlich jedes Wochenende Workshop zu den verschiedensten Themen der cubanischen Tänze. - http://lda.in/index.php?arg=PROGRAMM#ws


Professionelle Trainer - alle mit abgeschlossenem Studium an der ISA - der cubanischen nationalen Kunsthochschule fuer Tänzer, Choreographen und Tanzpädagogen - bringen auch dem *steifsten* Norddeutschen caribisches Körperbewusstsein nahe.


Erst einmal aber viel Spass allen, die mit ihren Freunden dabeisein koennen, viel Spass in der langen Nacht auf den Vatertag in der Hamburger Innenstadt.

867714443357074.loc_name: FM4 Indiekiste mit JAKE BUGG, Support: Blossoms
867714443357074.description:
███████████████████████

FM4 INDIEKISTE mit JAKE BUGG
Support: Blossoms

███████████████████████

Nachdem Jake Bugg im Februar 2016 überraschend den neuen Song "On My One" veröffentlichte, steht nun fest, dass bereits am 17. Juni 2016 das gleichnamige dritte Studio-Album des Briten folgt. Mit der unglaublich energiegeladenen ersten Single "Gimme The Love" gibt es zudem einen zweiten Sound-Vorboten aus dem "Shangri La"-Nachfolger. Funky Drums, Wah-Wah-Gitarren und Vocals mit Spoken-Word-Effekt machen den Track zu einem Highlight und bilden einen starken Kontrast zu der eher langsamen Blues-Nummer "On My One".

Der Titel des neuen Albums basiert auf einer Redewendung, die in Jakes Heimatstadt Nottingham gebräuchlich ist – und die den Nagel wirklich auf den Kopf trifft: "On my one" ist quasi eine Doppelung des üblichen "on my own". "Und diese drei Worte bringen in vielerlei Hinsicht die Essenz dieses Albums auf den Punkt", erklärt Jake Bugg, "weil ich tatsächlich einen Großteil der Arbeit gänzlich im Alleingang erledigt habe. In meiner Entwicklung als Songschreiber war das für mich einfach der logische nächste Schritt. Es war sicherlich keine leichte Aufgabe, aber ich hatte das Gefühl, diesen Schritt einfach machen zu müssen."

Alle elf Tracks der Platte wurden von Jake Bugg selbst geschrieben und größtenteils selbst produziert – bei drei Stücken ließ er sich von Produzent Jackknife Lee helfen. Außerdem spielte er so gut wie alle Instrumente selbst ein. Mit "On My One" zeigt Jake Bugg die unendlichen Facetten seines Songwritings. Zu den weiteren Höhepunkten des neuen Albums, das in London, Los Angeles und Nottingham aufgenommen wurde, zählen "Love Hope And Misery" mit seinem eindringlichen, überdimensionalen Refrain, das druckvolle "Bitter Salt" sowie "Never Wanna Dance" und der programmatische Titelsong.

███████████████████████

1188863564464949.loc_name: We Run the City 5K presented by University Credit Union
1188863564464949.description:
Rivals UCLA and USC are coming together for a great movement! This fundraiser celebrates the annual UCLA vs. USC football game’s Rivalry Week, and has alternated campuses over the last four years. The tradition continues when #WeRunTheCity5K returns to UCLA on November 20, 2016.

We Run the City is an annual 5K rivalry run/walk between USC and UCLA that supports Special Olympics Southern California. Alumni, faculty, fans, staff, and students of USC and UCLA are invited to compete for bragging rights and the We Run the City trophy.

HOW TO WIN
Each runner/walker must declare their allegiance at the time of registration and whether they are an alumni, faculty, fan, staff, or student. They are then a part of Team USC or Team UCLA. Competition is broken into the three categories above. The school that wins at least two out of three, claims victory and their school has bragging rights and the trophy for the year!

PRICE
•	$30 until 4/3 at 5 p.m.
•	$35 from 4/3 at 5 p.m. to 8/31
•	$40 from 9/1 - 10/31
•	$45 from 11/1 - 11/12
•	$50 from 11/13 through race weekend
•	SoCal Summer Pack - $79 until 9/5 - includes race registration, medal and a SoCal Summer Pack which includes a tank top, flip flops and a beach bag; all items will be in either UCLA or USC colors and have #WeRunTheCity5k branding. No discount codes or special pricing.

REGISTER
To register, visit www.werunthecity.com.

ABOUT SPECIAL OLYMPICS SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA
Special Olympics Southern California enriches the lives of children and adults with intellectual disabilities and their communities through sports, education, and athlete health. Your generous support helps fund Special Olympics programs. Every dollar raised through We Run the City not only provides free year-round sports training and competitions for our athletes, it also gives them empowerment, joy, and improved health. For more information, visit sosc.org.

685099144977618.loc_name: Halloween Trash - As Bruxas de Trashfield
685099144977618.description:
Halloween Trash – As Bruxas de Trashfield

A festa de Halloween da Trash 80’s continua sendo a mais divertida de São Paulo. São 15 anos de noites macabras e mais de 30mil pessoas que passaram pelas edições na cidade.  Em 2016 acontecerá no Club Hotel Cambridge, sábado, 29 de outubro, a partir das 23h

COMPRE INGRESSOS ANTECIPADOS E PAGUE MENOS
https://www.sympla.com.br/halloween-trash---as-bruxas-de-trashfield__92645

Sem nunca ter repetido um tema, neste ano as bruxas invadem o antigo Hotel do centro de São Paulo. Todos os ambientes serão decorados para proporcionar um imersão no universo da feitiçaria e da magia.  Atores e bailarinos convidam o público a desvendar uma floresta assustadora, cheia de mistérios, por corredores de forcas, caldeirões, poções, fogueiras artificiais e seres prontos a proporcionar aquele delicioso medo em todos os presentes.

Mais uma vez a trupe da Space Magic comanda o espetáculo e também a cenografia da festa. A equipe é composta pelos mesmos artistas que produziam as “Noites do Terror” do Playcenter e que estão à frente da “Hora do Horror”, do Hopi Hari. Para quem deixar pra se produzir em cima da hora, o Halloween Trash disponibilizará no lounge profissionais para maquiagem, inteiramente grátis.

585866291597437.loc_name: CAS Cambridge presents Prince - Sign o' the Times
585866291597437.description:
***Update***

Guest Speaker Announced - Author, Matt Thorne!

Matt wrote 'Prince', widely regarded as one of the best biographies on the man and he will be presenting so look forward to great insight into the man during the Q&A as well!

I'm sure he'll sign your copy if you already have the book also!

See more on Matt and his book here: http://bit.ly/2cPYQl2

For our second event in Cambridge, we have decided to go purple and as we are featuring Prince - Sign 'O' The Times!

Following on from 1986’s Parade, Sign o the Times is the first release from Prince after eight albums with The Revolution. The departure from his band allowed Prince even more freedom in the studio and time to experiment. Initial plans for a triple LP project were balked at by Warner Bros (a fact that would later result in Prince publicly refusing to work and branding his deal “a slave contract”) and he was forced to scale back his plans to a mere double LP. The Linn LM-1 drum machine and Fairlight CMI feature heavily throughout the album, as do other effects that were being experimented with heavily at the time such as sped up vocals resulting in the arrival of Camille, Prince’s alter ego.

Read more here:
http://classicalbumsundays.com/cas-cambridge-presents-prince-sign-o-the-times/

Whilst reviewing the album for it’s 25th anniversary Tom Brielhan noted, “It crystallised all the artistic experimentation of those previous two albums into something huge and tangible, displaying Prince as a musical adventurer without equal. Prince tries out a ton of different musical ideas on the album, and he nails almost all of them. It’s a thing to behold… Sign o the Times is probably Prince’s most complete piece of self-presentation, the best possible example of how he wanted the world to see him. It’s an absolute essential.”

Audio Menu:

Linn LP12 Akurate
Plinius Koru phono stage
Plinius Kaitaki pre-amplifier
Plinius SA-Reference power amplifier
KEF Reference 5

Day Release Criterion Audio Ltd Hidden Rooms Classic Album Sundays

784202735049274.loc_name: We Run the City 5K - USC Alumni Team
784202735049274.description:
Rivals UCLA and USC are coming together for a great movement! This fundraiser celebrates the annual UCLA vs. USC football game’s Rivalry Week, and has alternated campuses over the last four years. The tradition continues when #WeRunTheCity5K returns to UCLA on November 20, 2016.

We Run the City is an annual 5K rivalry run/walk between USC and UCLA that supports Special Olympics Southern California. Alumni, faculty, fans, staff, and students of USC and UCLA are invited to compete for bragging rights and the We Run the City trophy.

********************************************
Join our team at http://sosc.kintera.org/werunthecity/latrojans.
Use discount code ALUMNI!
********************************************

Benefits:
Official We Run the City Dry Fit Shirt
Finisher Medal presented by an SOSC Athlete
Pre/Post Race Fan Fest

HOW TO WIN
Each runner/walker must declare their allegiance at the time of registration and whether they are an alumni, faculty, fan, staff, or student. They are then a part of Team USC or Team UCLA. Competition is broken into the three categories above. The school that wins at least two out of three, claims victory and their school has bragging rights and the trophy for the year!

PRICE (**Use discount code ALUMNI**)
• $35 from 4/3 at 5 p.m. to 8/31
• $40 from 9/1 - 10/31
• $45 from 11/1 - 11/12
• $50 from 11/13 through race weekend
• SoCal Summer Pack - $79 until 9/5 - includes race registration, medal and a SoCal Summer Pack which includes a tank top, flip flops and a beach bag; all items will be in either UCLA or USC colors and have #WeRunTheCity5k branding. No discount codes or special pricing.

REGISTER
To register, visit http://sosc.kintera.org/werunthecity/latrojans.

ABOUT SPECIAL OLYMPICS SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA
Special Olympics Southern California enriches the lives of children and adults with intellectual disabilities and their communities through sports, education, and athlete health. Your generous support helps fund Special Olympics programs. Every dollar raised through We Run the City not only provides free year-round sports training and competitions for our athletes, it also gives them empowerment, joy, and improved health. For more information, visit sosc.org.

784144671648440.loc_name: Sing’n’Joy Princeton 2017 - The American International Choral Festival
784144671648440.description:
In 2017, the choirs of the world will sing together in Princeton, New Jersey, for the Grand Prize of this SING’N’JOY event. 

Bearing the slogan “Singing and Joy”, the Sing’n’joy Princeton will be taking place from February 16 to 19, 2017. The Sing’n’Joy concept also includes concerts and manifold encounters between the participating choirs. The competitions will be taking place in the Princeton High School Center of Performing Arts and Westminster Choir College will open their Chapel for the “Musica Sacra” category and for concerts. One of the highlights of the event will be ensembles from Westminster Choir College who will present their world class quality in the Grand Opening and maybe also on other occasions during the festival. 

Conductors and Singers will be given the chance to attend master classes held by Morten Lauridsen and other choral experts and why not enjoy the beauty of New Jersey, the so called “Garden State”, with its 127 miles of coastline on the Atlantic Ocean, more than 800 lakes and ponds, 36 state parks, 24 historic sites and much more. 

On Monday, February 20, which will mark the President´s Day in 2017, an official holiday, the choirs will have the opportunity to visit New York and even to sing there … but that shall remain a secret at the present time … stay tuned to learn more about it soon.

Detailed information on the event schedule can be found here: http://www.interkultur.com/events/2017/princeton/

898014626994811.description:
Its our biggest party yet. the one and only GRANT NELSON is coming to Cambridge...  

Nelson is heralded as the Godfather of UK Garage due to his numerous club hits on his Nice 'n' Ripe label in the early 90's. It was his sound along with a few others that gave birth to the then known as 'Sunday Scene' which went on to become UK Garage.

He also produced under the name Wishdokta from 1990-1993 when he was making Hardcore / Drum N Bass for the legendary label Kickin Records.

In 97 he started using the alter-ego Bump & Flex and began to produce UK 2 Step. He delivered some of the scenes biggest records by far including the incredible "Funk On Ah Roll" by James Brown.

Nelson has always remained a house head since his early Nice 'n' Ripe days and continues to do so to the present with his excellent Swing City label that consistently delivers top drawer house music.

In support we welcome back some of our Brighter Days favourites bringing their soulful/ house/ disco vibes.

Brad France (CC / D3EP) 
Lil'Joey (Housebound/Brighter Days)
Blackwax (Bump n Hustle)
Stu Sargent (Brighter Days)

Tickets on sale NOW via http://ticketstore.eclecticbars.co.uk/fez-club-cambridge/events
Good times GUARANTEED.

195843350582893.description:

English version: https://www.facebook.com/events/500692710021829

Für alle, die Havannas Tanz- und Musikszene dieses Jahr noch pur und intensiv erleben möchten - vom 26. Nov. bis zum 03. Dez. und vom 03. bis zum 10. Dezember - mit professionellen Tanzpartnern natürlich.

Einmal im Leben solltest Du Dir das auch gönnen – bevor McDonalds kommt!!

--- Havanna pur erleben - Salsa, diesen authentischen Rhythmus Cubas, zusammen mit den Stars der cubanischen Szene erleben.

Fredyclan Garcia Batista und Requena Delgado nehmen Euch mit in ihre pulsierende Stadt, in der Musik und Tanz gelebt werden. 

7 Tage voll mit intensivem Unterricht in kleinen Gruppen mit cubanischen Tanzpartnern, indviduell abgestimmt auf die jeweiligen Teilnehmer.

Unterbringung in mit Liebe geführten, speziell ausgesuchten Casa Particulares oder einem der Kolonial- oder Strandhotels.

Vielseitiges Begleitprogramm - Strandparty am Playa del Este - Besuch des 1830 http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6Si7zwbqSVY - und vieles andere mehr!

Cubas Musiker zum Anfassen! Abends die cubanische Musik live erleben in Matineen oder Nachtkonzerten - dabei die Musiker auch einmal Backstage kennen lernen. 


Im Preis von nur € 985,-- für das gesamte Programm eingeschlossene Leistungen:

Transfers innerhalb Havannas: vom Flughafen oder einem der Hotels zum Hotel oder zu den Casas Particulares, Transporte zu den angegebenen Ausflugszielen, Konzerten, Matineen und Partys, sowie bei Abflug zurück zum Flughafen Jose Martí.

7 Übernachtungen im DZ einer Casa Particular, alternativ in einem Kolonialhotel (auf Wunsch EZ – Aufpreis € 95,—) incl. gemeinsamen Abendessens.

Intensiver Tanzunterricht - jeweils mit cubanischem Tanzpartner - durchgeführt von ausgesuchten Trainern mit exzellenter Ausbildung - sowie leidenschaftliches Tanzen am Strand, am Pool und bei den Konzerten!

Individuelle Betreuung durch Fredy Garcia Batista, Tänzer - Choreograph - Musiker, weltweit bekannt durch seine vielen Tourneen, die ihn mit Lady Salsa, Havanna Rumba, The Bar at Buena Vista und vielen anderen Produktionen an die interessantesten Orte auf diesem Planeten führten.

Individuelle Betreuung durch Requena Delgado, Tänzerin - Choreographin - Tanzpädagogin, künstlerische Leiterin der Latin Dance Academy, die sie binnen kürzester Zeit an die europäische Spitze führte und mit aktuell mehr als 1.200 aktiven Schülern zur weltweit größten Dance Academy für cubanische Tänze machte.


Komm doch auch mit und erleb, wie sich Cuba pur anfühlen wird. Erleb die Wurzeln der Salsa und tauch mit ein in das pulsierende Leben dieser brodelnden, sich ständig verändernden größten Stadt der Caribic.

1651818181814909.description:
OS Cinema brings you monthly screening events from independent filmmakers at renowned East London loft venue, Oval Space.

Synopsis:
Twenty-four male students out of seventy-five were selected to take on randomly assigned roles of prisoners and guards in a mock prison situated in the basement of the Stanford psychology building. Based on a true story.

Hot food, pop corn and full bar available.

Curated with dedication to the art and power of filmmaking, OS Cinema covers everything from groundbreaking political documentaries to art house explorations. Always geared to adding something extra to the cinematic experience, this is not your average trip to the flicks. From Q + A’s with directors, to heated panel discussions, our programme looks to engage and inspire film fans.

Come and enjoy our carefully selected range of independent films from across the globe, in a space where people can come together to eat, drink, talk and expand their minds.

Info
Stanford Prison Experiment: Year: 2015 - Director: Kyle Patrick Alvarez - Distributor: Filmbank - Country: USA - Language: English - Runtime: 122 min

Doors open at 7.15pm. Film starts at 7.45pm.

This is an 18+ event.

266984020360117.description:
[Group size 20 – 5 x places left] - Soulful Long Weekend Away - Friday 17th – Tuesday 21st March 2017 - Hearth & Soul Eco Farm - Stanford area, Guided Fynbos Trail by http://www.fynbostrail.co.za & Ancient Forest Experience. Also included a visit to Agulhas National Park, the southernmost tip of the African and where two great oceans meet - [Group size 20 – 5 x places left] - Hosted by Awakening Intuition Nature Walks, Retreats, Soulful Weekends Away, Events & Hiking – Connecting Like-minded people - "VERY IMPORTANT" -- Please email first or call me directly (Do not just mark yourself as going on Facebook / Meetup) to check for availability and to book on - iain@awakening-intuition.com or for more info, contact Iain Macdonald on Tel: 072 3272840 or 021 4626755  - This event is booked in advance to make the most of the 2017 public holidays.

Cost: R 2000.00 per person or if you are not able to pay the full amount, then a 50% deposit to secure your booking with the balance to be paid on the 1st of  October 2016. This will be a self- catering option, with shared communal lunch and dinner.

This will be a 5 day / 4 night away trip, starting on the Friday from 12pm, with arrival no later than 4pm for the start of the event and our opening circle and ending on Sunday afternoon 3pm for our closing circle get together and sharing. Please check that you can commit to these times before joining. The Tuesday a public holiday, so you will only need to take off the Friday and the Monday from work. Long weekends will be booked in advance as it is the only way to secure longer stays over public holidays. 

Included in the payment will be your self-catering accommodation for the 4 x nights and the various guided activities on offer. These include a visit Cape Agulhas Nature Reserve & Cape Agulhas is the place where two great oceans meet. At Cape Agulhas we will also do one of the Hiking trails and visit the light house with a guided tour of the history. We will hike day one of the Fynbos Trail – (7,5km)  guided by Sean Privett - http://www.fynbostrail.co.za – This was the same part of the trail that a few of us got to do on the Slack packing trail in March 2016 to this ancient forest where most of the trees are over 1000 years old. Time will also be allocated own time to relax, read, reflect swim in the two beautiful swimming dams, this will be great as it is summer time or just connect with like-minded people. Hearth & Soul is an eco-farm and spiritual retreat centre with a difference. Suitable for Most Levels of Fitness, but some minimum fitness is required.

From our trip in March 2016 Hearth and Soul was recommended as a venue one of the favourite group venues to date. A complete nature experience for the body, mind and Soul.  

The self-catering accommodation is located just 24km from Stanford / or 175km or 2h15min from Cape Town. Wherever possible we will share the Transport in getting there.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

What is on offer: Two of the highlight experiences will be the Guided Fynbos Trail and the Trip down to Cape Agulhas Nature Reserve, the southern tip of Africa. A few of got to do the famous Fynbos Slack Packing Trail in Gansbaai area back in March 2016. We were so impressed by the diversity of the plant and tree species that by special arrangement we will be doing day one again, this time guided Sean Privett - http://www.fynbostrail.co.za – Sean also co-wrote the field Guide to the flora of Grootbos Nature Reserve. The hike includes time spent in the Steynsbos and Grootbos Milkwood forest – two of only eight milk wood forests of this kind in the world. Many of the trees here are over 1000 years old. Hikers also walk through limestone fynbos, a very rare fynbos type of which many species are only found in this small area. 

We will also be visiting Cape Agulhas, which is located about an hour from where we staying. Once in the Reserve we will be doing the 5,5km Rasperpunt Hiking Trail along the coast and through the coastal fynbos. We will also visit the museum and do tour of the light house and learn a more about the history of this area. The sea off Cape Agulhas is notorious for winter storms and mammoth rogue waves, which can range up to 30 metres. This has been due to the two oceans meet in winter and the nature of the coastal shelf.  Over the past few hundred years it has been believed that around 150 ships have sunk around Agulhas. If it’s warm day we will also stop for a swim in one of the tidal pools in the Indian Ocean

We will also be doing on one of the mornings a guided walk up to Pigs’s Snout Kloof and the Waterfall trail located about 20min from where we are staying. Sybille at Heart & Soul is also in the process of setting up a new trail that we will also explore.

The scenic surroundings will provide an ideal space for relaxation and re-connecting within especially because we are there for an extended amount of days. Not to mention connecting with like-minded people who share similar soulful interests.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

Hearth & Soul is perfectly situated in a secluded valley between the hamlets of Stanford and Napier in the Sandy’s Glen area, undoubtedly one of the Overberg’s best-kept secrets. Hearth & Soul is located 24km from Stanford / or 175km from Cape Town.

Our accommodation is situated on a working eco farm, accommodating 24 guests comfortably in 13 x bedrooms. Hearth and Soul accommodation comprises 13 en-suite bedrooms with lovely patios and balcony views of the mountains. Each room has been individually decorated - simply and comfortably, using the buildings and natural surroundings as inspiration. There are also lots of comfortable areas to relax into and enjoy the stunning views

I look forward to you joining us. Love and blessings. Iain

------------------------------------------------------------------------

PLEASE NOTE:
--------------------

For this weekend away and that it is in advance, it will be "Open to all" as long as you have been on THREE of the regular Sunday walks at least by date of the 4th of December 2016. This normally applies to all the weekends away, with a simple requirement is having joined at least three normal regular Sunday Walks throughout the year or at least in the 6 months before a weekend away. 

This way I can gauge fitness levels, this also enhances, the sense of soulful connectedness, as you will know most of the people going. The weekends away offer a combination of adventure of soulfulness in relaxation group sharing and time out is allocated for quiet time. I also get a chance to meet you and you will get to know what is on offer. This weekend away will be suitable for most levels of fitness. The time out in, offers time out to be able to slow down a little to enjoy the views and connect with like-minded people.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

"This is the only moment that is real. To be here and now, and enjoy the present moment is our most important task. - Thich Nhat Hanh

------------------------------------------------------------------------
ABOUT HEARTH & SOUL ECO FARM 
http://www.hearthandsoul.co.za/
------------------------------------------------------------------------

Hearth & Soul is perfectly situated in a secluded valley between the hamlets of Stanford and Napier in the Sandy’s Glen area, undoubtedly one of the Overberg’s best-kept secrets.

Set on 220 hectares of spectacular mountainside, alive with diverse fynbos, poplar and eucalyptus forests, four small dams and a pristine river running through the property, Hearth and Soul is the ideal venue for team-building getaways, courses, workshops and small conferences. The setting also lends itself to magical weddings and unforgettable private functions with an intimate and natural flavour. The original farm buildings have been extensively and lovingly upgraded, in a conscious and eco-friendly manner. Our own poplar and blue-gum trees were used for beams and internal woodwork, adding to the unique charm of our venue. We are lucky to have our drinking water supplied directly via gravity-feed from a nearby mountain spring, and we pump from the perennial river to irrigate the farm lands.

The fully equipped farm house where we will be staying is very private and safe with magnificent views of the surrounding mountains. The kitchen is fully equipped with cookware, cutlery, crockery, cloths, dishwashing liquid etc. 

The double-story Farmhouse has been lovingly restored, with reclaimed doors, roughly plastered walls, dakriet ceilings and beams hewn from local poplar trees among the special touches. The Farmhouse features a total of 13 bedrooms, each uniquely decorated in a mix of contemporary and antique furnishings, and accommodating two to three guests. Eleven of the rooms are en-suite, each with either a patio or balcony and gorgeous mountain views. 

The communal living areas are spacious and creatively decorated, and the atmosphere homely. There’s a lounge with fireplace, a patio with dining area and a laid-back farm-style kitchen with dining table. From here it's a step away to a comfy couch and fireplace in the sunroom. Step onto the rolling lawn and you’ll find a central fire pit with communal seating on the banks of one of four farm dams. 

Visit the inspiring permaculture gardens, take in some of the lovely fynbos trails on the farm, or head out and explore the villages of Napier and Stanford. Or just hang out and enjoy this superb setting. 

Tapping into natural resources

Hearth & Soul believe that art and nature have tremendous power and can help greatly with emotional, mental and creative blocks. Hearth & Soul is a store house of natural resources, including wood, bracken and all sorts of other bits and pieces with which to play and create! Their focus is on growth, but everything they do at Hearth & Soul is infused with JOY.

----------------------------------------------------------
ABOUT – THE FRYNBOS TRAIL
http://www.fynbostrail.co.za
----------------------------------------------------------

On the Saturday we will be doing day one of the normal 3 day Slack Packing Fynbos Trail. The part that we will be doing of the Fynbos Trail – (7,5km) will be guided by Sean Privett - http://www.fynbostrail.co.za – This was the same part of the trail that a few of us got to do on the Slack packing trail in March 2016 to this ancient forest where most of the trees are over 1000 years old. This is certainly one of the oldest forests that I have been to before. Sean also co-wrote the field Guide to the flora of Grootbos Nature Reserve. The hike includes time spent in the Steynsbos and Grootbos Milkwood forest – two of only eight milk wood forests of this kind in the world. Hikers also walk through limestone fynbos, a very rare fynbos type of which many species are only found in this small area. 

The trail starts at Growing the Future Sustainable Agriculture and Life Skills College on Grootbos Nature Reserve. From Growing the Future the trail leads through coastal strandveld into the Steynsbos Milkwood forest, one of only eight milkwood forests of its type in the world, all of which are found in the Stanford-Gansbaai area. An island surrounded by fynbos, this small patch of forest contains trees that are many hundreds, if not thousands of years old and is refuge for a number of animals and birds not commonly seen in the fynbos. Thirty four bird species, including Rameron pigeon, Cape Batis, African paradise flycatcher and forest buzzard have been sighted as well as a variety of mammals including bushbuck, porcupine, honey badger and mongoose. By hiking the trail you contribute directly towards the conservation and social development work of the partners within the conservancy. Some of the funds generated by the trail are re-invested into clearing alien vegetation, managing fire and documenting and monitoring flora and fauna within the conservancy.

A true voyage of discovery, led by a passionate, expert guide who points out the various endemics and rare species and explains the that role the various birds, ants and other propagators play in the eco-system. More than 800 fynbos species have been identified along the route and, whatever time of year you walk there is always something in bloom. As you go you learn about the remarkable diversity and fascinating ecology of the proteas, ericas, reeds and wonderful bulbs, gaining an understanding of their preferred habitats and their remarkable tricks. The seeds of the local limestone pincushion (Leucospermum pattersoni) have a waxy coating that attract the local pugnacious ants, who carry the seeds to the safety of their underground nests, where ants are rewarded with nutritious seed coat as food and the seed is planted out of harmï¿½s way until a future fire activated germination!  

As you wander you begin to understand the uniqueness of this trail. Vegetation studies on Grootbos Nature Reserve have recorded six plant species that are new to science!

----------------------------------------------------------
ABOUT – CAPE AGULHAS NATIONAL PARK
https://www.sanparks.org/parks/agulhas/tourism/activities.php
----------------------------------------------------------

On the Sunday we will be visiting Agulhas National Park via Bredasdorp. Bredasdorp is also home to the Shipwreck Museum which tells the stories of the 150 ships that wrecked along the nearby Agulhas Reef. The only museum of its kind in the southern hemisphere.

Once in the national park, we will head down to the Southern most tip of Africa. The official position of the tip is 34° 49’ 58" south and 20° 00’ 12’’ east. A cairn marks the tip’s exact location. It is at this longitudinal point that the Atlantic and Indian oceans officially meet. We will visit the Cape Agulhas Lighthouse & Museum. The lighthouse was built to aid the early explorers on their passage of the rough seas off Cape Agulhas. Seventy-one steps lead up to the top of the second oldest working lighthouse in southern Africa. Stone mined from the adjacent limestone quarry provided the raw materials for its construction. The building also houses a unique lighthouse museum. Remains of ancient stone fish traps used by the Khoisan people can be seen to the east of the lighthouse.

=> Rasperpunt Hiking Trail 

This relaxing 5,5km circular hiking trail, with its start/end at the Meisho Maru shipwreck. Experience the coastline, coastal fynbos, ancient fish traps, fresh water fountains for the first half of the walk. Turn inland, cross the gravel road and work your way up the ridge with magnificent views of the Rasperpunt rock formations and the coastline. 

The Agulhas Plain has great diversity of flora. The Agulhas area contains representatives of unique vegetation such as limestone fynbos. Although most species bloom between May and September, there are flowers to be enjoyed in any season. Explore the Agulhas Plain with its great diversity of indigenous flora, and unique vegetation such as limestone fynbos!

Time permitting we will also stop for a swim in one of the tidal pools in Indian Ocean. 

------------------------------------------
ABOUT THE PIG’S SNOUT KLOOF AND WATERFALL 
------------------------------------------

This will be a walk on private lands with special permission up to the kloof and the waterfall. There is also a great swimming spot. This is an interesting formation in the Kleinrivier Mountains locals call “Pig’s Snout”. Over millennia, this kloof has been eroded to resemble the face of a pig with two waterfalls neatly running down the “nostrils”.

1744305879163909.loc_name: Michael Eric Dyson & The 2016 Presidential Election
1744305879163909.description:
On October 10, 2016, the African & African American Studies (AAAS) Program will host its annual St. Clair Drake Memorial Lecture featuring author, public intellectual, political analyst and Georgetown University Professor of Sociology Michael Eric Dyson. The lecture is entitled “The 2016 U.S. Presidential Election: Race & Gender in Post-Obama America."

In line with AAAS’ current focus on contemporary racial justice movements and electoral politics in the U.S., Dyson will discuss his most recent book, The Black Presidency: Barack Obama and the Politics of Race in America.  It discusses the impact of race, racism, and the movement for racial justice on the upcoming 2016 presidential election. He will speak on the stakes of Black America in this election, the resonance of Black Lives Matter on the campaign trail, the history of voting rights in America, the impact of gender on campaign strategies, and the changing face of the U.S. presidency.

Following his lecture, Dyson will be joined on stage by AAAS Director and Stanford School of Education Professor H. Samy Alim, University of Southern California Associate Professor of Political Science & Gender Studies Ange-Marie Hancock, and Lehigh University Director of Africana Studies and Associate Professor of English James Braxton Peterson.

This lecture and dialogue is free and open to the public. It will be held at the Bechtel Conference Center in Encina Hall at Stanford University (616 Serra Street, Stanford, CA 94305). Doors will open at 6:30pm and the program will begin promptly at 7:00pm.

The Cambridge Vegan Market welcomes everyone, whether you're vegan, vegetarian or just interested we are sure you’ll find many things you love at the market. There will be over 50 stalls selling a range of food, drinks, clothes and cosmetics alongside stalls with information about charities, nutrition and the environment.

The market will be held in the Guildhall (right next to the market place) and will open to the public from 10:30am on Sunday 16th and will close at 4:30pm. Tickets will be available on the door and will cost £2 for adults and will be free for kids under 12. We expect the venue to get very busy during the day so please come along early so you don’t miss out.

The first 100 people to arrive will get FREE vegan cake and everyone that brings their own mug will get a free coffee or tea. 

10% of all profits from this event are given directly to the environmental charities we support.

If you would like to exhibit please get in touch on info@earthevents.co.uk

Cambridge Vegan Market is organised by Earth Events Limited. Take at look at our other markets on www.veganmarkets.co.uk and www.earthevents.co.uk.
