1243608342326504.description:
"This record could be studied in university as the synthesis of the deep-house scene of the early 1990s. Classic.”
- Rush Hour

“A revelation – deep, soulful and hard-grooving, it calls to mind the masterful work of Larry Heard, and deserves to be considered a classic not just of house, but of electronic soul at large.”
-Fact Mag

26 years after the release of their self-titled classic NYC deep house cut, Dream 2 Science perform live for the first time ever...

Prior to its re-issue on Rushour in 2012, the Dream 2 Science 6-tracker stood as something of a legendary lost treasure for true house heads the world over, with first edition copies trading hands for outrageous sums of money.  Rush Hour lovingly brought the hidden gem to life for a community of music aficionados young and old, but few could have dreamed that this seminal music would ever be performed live.

Brought to you by the same trio behind the pioneering 80s electro-funk and hip-hop outfit Newcleus, Cozmo D, Lady E and Gregg 'G4' Fore will bring life to this classic record for the first time ever.  The prospect is tantalizing, ripping 303 baselines, soaring vocals, and the unmistakable raw aesthetic of the early 90s brought to you by the true originators themselves. In their own words it's going to be "smooth, deep, laid back and hella sexy."

1780408005572582.description:
We are ridiculously excited to announce the creation of a brand new competition- Cambridge Women’s Schools! This competition has been set up in order to make the university circuit a much more friendly and welcoming environment for young female debaters. 

This is an event for university and older debaters to sign up, a seperate google doc will be emailed to schools for speakers to sign up. 

Format
The competition will be a pro am with a female/non-binary debater paired with a female/non-binary school student. It will be a standard British Parliamentary format with 5 minute speeches and a break to semis. The team cap is currently 40 but this can be expanded. 

n.b. am-am teams are also allowed, if schools would like to compete in this way. 

CAs 

Rebecca Meredith 
Rebecca was CA of Zagreb EUDC 2014, 3rd top speaker at EUDC 2012, 4th top team at WUDC 2013, WUDC quarter finalist and EUDC semi finalist, top breaking team, finalist and 2nd top speaker at the John Smith Memorial Mace English Championships in 2015 and winner and finalist of numerous IVs. She judged the Open Semi Final and Chennai WUDC. She has been on the CA teams of numerous tournaments including the HSE Open Moscow, the Cambridge IV, the UCL IV, the Budapest IV, the Paris Open, and many more and has taught debating in Sweden, Hong Kong, Russia and IONA. She is also the CA for the upcoming Women's EUDC 2017 in London.

Srishti Krishnamoorthy-Cavell
Srishti is a fourth year doctoral scholar in English at Cambridge and works on botanical poetics and politics in contemporary experimental writing. She was a semi-finalist and top 15 speaker at Vienna EUDC, a winner of four competitions and a finalist at several others. This will be her 12th CAship, including previously Cambridge Women's, Trinity IV, Utrecht Open and Edinburgh Open. She has also broken as judge at about 20 competitions.

Jessica Yung 
Jessica is a 2nd year Economics student at Newnham College. She is a CA of the International Competition for Young Debaters, was DCA of the Cardiff Open and has chaired rounds at the World Universities' Debating Championship, European Universities’ Debating Championships, Cambridge Schools and Imperial Schools. Jessica has won Dulwich Schools and three tournaments in Hong Kong. She was also a finalist at Durham Schools and LSE Schools.

Inclusion
There will be full bursaries and funding provided to disadvantaged schools. We will also be ensuring that a fair proportion of team spots go to students from disadvantaged backgrounds rather than working on a first come first served basis. Additionally, workshops will be advertised and provided to disadvantaged schools who are attending the competition. This will ensure everyone receives a basic level of BP experience so they’re confident enough to attend. 

Safeguarding
We are requiring schools to provide a teacher or parent to accompany the students (one per school). Additionally, there will be permission slips and forms that will be sent to all schools. 

Sign up sheet: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1bFO_0iEDdTuhtC8pAUGR-ikH4uFwsDcAIZMRVahVOOg/edit

Inquiries
debating@cus.org 

Lydia Day and Sarah Christie (convenors)

vigozone lädt euch zu einem außergewöhnlichen DJ-Gig ein! Erlebt Felix Jaehn und seine unverwechselbaren Sounds live und hautnah. Das ganz besondere Event ist nur für die Gewinner unserer #Sendepause-Aktion – Tickets gibt es nirgendwo zu kaufen!

Mit seinem Cheerleader-Remix gelang Felix Jaehn ein Welterfolg. Als erster deutscher Künstler nach über 26 Jahren schaffte er den Sprung auf Platz 1 der US-Charts und führte in 55 Ländern die Download-Charts an. Ain’t Nobody, Book of Love oder auch Bonfire sind nur ein kleiner Auszug seiner Hits, mit denen Felix Jaehn weltweit unterwegs ist und regelmäßig Charterfolge landet.

Gewinnen könnt ihr von September 2016 bis Januar 2017 monatlich als Schulklasse bzw. Schülergruppe oder gemeinsam mit euren besten Freunden in der vigozone-App. Für Schulklassen gibt’s außerdem die Chance auf insgesamt 3.000 EURO für die Klassenkassen.

1072809579454069.loc_name: Apply to UCLA Campus Tours | Apps Due 10/21
1072809579454069.description:
Do you think you can rock a baby blue polo?
Do you count walking backwards as a sufficient method of cardio?
Do you love UCLA more than words can describe?

If you answered “yes” to any or all of these questions, then consider the UCLA Campus Tours Program!

As a Campus Tour Guide, you’ll work closely with the Office of Undergraduate Admission and the Campus Tours Program to showcase UCLA to prospective and admitted students, their families and other campus visitors. We are looking for motivated and personable students to provide a glimpse of a “day in the life” at UCLA while sharing the incredible academic and extracurricular opportunities and experiences one might have on campus.

To apply, please complete an application and submit it to 148 Kerckhoff Hall between 10/10 and 10/21 by 4:00 pm AND a digital version to apply.uclatours@gmail.com.

Applications will be available on October 10th, and can be found online at www.admissions.ucla.edu/tours.

Additionally, we will be hosting two on-campus information sessions on Monday, October 3rd at 8:00 pm in Dodd 78, and Thursday, October 6th at 6:00 pm in Dodd 170. Both sessions will answer questions and provide more information about the application and the program itself. 

If you have any questions, please email apply.uclatours@gmail.com

Go Bruins!

FREE FLU SHOTS FROM UCLA Arthur Ashe Student Health & Wellness Center AND UCLA School of Nursing.

What causes chills, muscle aches, a fever, and can last for 4-6 weeks? If you guessed “the flu,” you made the grade. And those are just some of the symptoms that might keep you out of class and away from those study sessions. Here’s a pro tip: Avoid the flu all together with a flu shot from The Ashe Center! Getting a flu shot is a fast, easy way to protect yourself and to ensure that you don’t miss class and fall behind academically.

Join us for our Annual Flu Fair event on campus to receive your free flu shot:

Monday, October 24 (Bruin Plaza, from 8am-5pm)
Tuesday, October 25 (Bruin Plaza, from 8am-5pm)

If you can’t make it to our Flu Fairs, you can schedule an appointment for a free flu shot online, by phone or in person at The Ashe Center.

For additional Flu Fair dates, or to make a flu shot appointment, visit: http://www.studenthealth.ucla.edu/

USAC Student Wellness Commission (SWC), we would love your help!

1428707810679894.loc_name: Wir organisieren am 30.12.2013 eine Gedenkversammlung anlässlich des Todes des Schauspielers Paul Walker und seines Freundes Roger Rodas. Mit einer Spendenaktion für ROWW und Lichtblicke e.V.
1428707810679894.description:
!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!NEU INFOS; BITTE LSESEN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
16 Uhr heißt nicht, das die die erst später können, nicht kommen sollen, wir sind den ganzen tag dort, somit kommt wann ihr wollt. Ich denke es ist besser 16h-21h als 19h-21h.
Teilnehmen kann JEDER.....JEDES AUTO.. FUßGÄNGER AUSDRÜCKLICH ERWÜNSCHT.

Wir organisieren am 30.12.2013 eine Gedenkversammlung
anlässlich des Todes des Schauspielers Paul Walker und seines freundes Roger Rodas.
www.paul-walker.eu
Unser Vision ist: Viele, viele Autos und Motorräder, die die Motoren zum heulen bringen, um gebührend an den Tod unseres Idols zu erinnern. Wir möchten in diesem Zusammenhang da weitermachen, wo unser großes Idol Paul Walker durch seinen tragischen Tod gestoppt wurde, nämlich beim Spendensammeln für einen guten Zweck. Wir haben uns daher dazu entschlossen, unsere Einnahmen an die Vereine Lichtblicke e.V. und ROWW zu spenden. 

Eine Zusage vom Essen Autokino haben wir, jedoch werde ich mich bemühen noch eine größere Fläche zu organisieren.

Zu unserer Spendenaktion: 
Ab 2€ Spende könnt ihr euch entscheiden zwischen einem Armband, Trauerflor und einem Sticker. Bei einer Spende von 10€ bekommt ihr sogar ein T-shirt von Fruit of the Loom. 
Hiermit möchte ich noch einmal deutlich sagen, das die oben genannten Dinge nicht verkauft werden, Sie sind ein GESCHENK für jeden der spendet. 
Alle Spenden gehen direkt in große durchsichtige Spedendeboxen, die von Beamten am ende des Tages weggebracht werden.

Auf der von unseren Rechtsanwälten eingerichtete Sonderseite könnt Ihr Euch über die rechtlichen Entwicklungen in diesem Zusammenhang informieren. Der folgende Link führt Euch zu den Rechtsanwälten Eull & Partner, wo Ihr dann auf die Sonderseite gelangt:

www.eullundpartner.de

! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! NEW INFO , PLEASE LSESEN ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! !
16 clock does not mean that the later may not have come , we have the whole day there , so come when you want . I think it's better than 16h -21h 19h - 21h.
EVERYONE can participate ..... EVERY CAR .. PEDESTRIAN EXPRESS DESIRABLE .

We organize a memorial assembly on 30.12.2013
occasion of the death of actor Paul Walker and his friend Roger Rodas .
www.paul- walker.eu
Our vision is : Lots and lots of cars and motorcycles that bring to the engines roar to duly commemorate the death of our idol. We want to continue in this connection there, where our great idol Paul Walker was stopped by his tragic death , namely in fundraising for a good cause . We have therefore decided , our revenue eV to the clubs bright spots and ROWW to donate .

A commitment from the food drive-in theater we have , but I will try to organize an even larger area .

To our fundraiser :
From 2 € donation you can decide between you, a bracelet , black ribbon and a sticker . For a donation of 10 € you get even a T -shirt from Fruit of the Loom.
Hereby I would like to say once again clear that the above things are not sold , you are a GIFT for everyone who donates .
All donations go directly into large transparent Spedendeboxen that are taken away by officials at the end of the day.

1692129854448735.description:
Diwali is one of the most celebrated and festive events of the Hindu religion. Also known as Naraka Chathurdasi, it commemorates the victory of Krishna over the Demon Narakasura.It also celebrates the return of the valiant Lord Rama after his conquest of Ravana, joyous villagers light oil candles-diyas-giving the holiday its name of "Deepavali," or "the festival of lights."


The goal of USC HSO's annual Diwali event is to provide a place for students, away from home or near, to join in the prayer and merriment of a shared culture. We welcome students from all backgrounds and religions to celebrate with us as we engage in a night of flavorful cuisine, diverse performances, and high-spirited fun. It's the brightest night of the semester!

1144145972273398.loc_name: Biologischer Baumwollanbau mit den Chukwuemeka Schwestern
1144145972273398.description:
Baumwolle steht für gute Hautverträglichkeit und hohen Tragekomfort und ist deshalb nach wie vor das weltweit führende Material in der Textilherstellung: Über 50 Prozent aller Textilien enthalten die weiße Faser. Dabei ist das Tragen von Baumwollprodukten nicht ganz unproblematisch. Denn beim Anbau werden Pestizide eingesetzt, das kann zu gesundheitlichen Schäden beim Tragen der Kleidung führen. Zudem verbraucht der Anbau der Naturfaser so viel Wasser wie alle Privathaushalte weltweit zusammen. Höhere Nachfrage aus den Schwellenländern – allen voran China – sorgen für darüber hinaus steigende Preise. 

Mit Ihrem Projekt "More Cotton-Less Racism" fangt man schon zum Schmunzeln an. Doch genau diesen Effekt nutzen die Chukwuemeka Schwestern um Ihre Botschaft in den Köpfen der Menschen zu gravieren. Sie werden euch Ihre naturschonenden Agrarmethoden näher brngen und über Ihre weltweiten Erfolge berichten.

Eintritt: Freiwillige Spende (Der Reinerlös fließt auf das Spendenkonto der Chukwuemeka Schwestern

Das wird wahrscheinlich eine der kontroversesten Events von und, jedoch distanzieren wir und ganz klar vom Rassismus.

1644483465881705.description:
For further details and registration: http://www.humaislamicfinanceconference.com/

The 2016 HUMA Islamic Finance Conference aims to bring together thought-leaders, practitioners, scholars and students in a critical and productive dialogue to assess the role that Islamic finance can play in realizing the UN's Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). The Conference will examine the functions that Islamic finance, with its risk-sharing approach, can perform in achieving the SDGs, while also critically probing the institutional constraints and the product limitations that may challenge the Islamic finance industry in making a meaningful impact.

In 2015, the United Nations adopted the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), and they constitute a vision for eradicating poverty while protecting the environment and ensuring shared prosperity. Each goal has specific targets to be achieved in the next 15 years.

Our speakers list includes:
- Khalid Latif, Executive Director and Chaplain at the Islamic Center at New York University and Co-founder of Honest Chops Butchery
- Khaled ElSayed, Chief Executive Officer, Guidance Residential
- Yusuf Talal DeLorenzo, Renown Shariah Scholar
- Asim I. Khwaja, Professor of International Finance and Development & Co-Director of Evidence for Policy Design,
Harvard Kennedy School
- Rifaat Abdel Karim, Chief Executive Officer, International Islamic Liquidity Management Corporation (Malaysia)
- Michael Bennett, Head of Derivatives & Structured Finance, World Bank
...and many more! 

Full program can be found here: http://www.humaislamicfinanceconference.com/program/

1192294730837995.description:
In celebration of International Archaeology Day - Oct. 15th, Persian Student Association (PSA) and American Institute of Archaeology (AIA) at Stanford Jointly Present:

5000 Years of Iranian Engineering 

[Movie Screening + Q&A with the writer, director, and producer, Dr. Farzin Rezaeian]

Venue: Bishop Auditorium, Stanford
Date/Time: Oct. 15th, 5:00 - 7:30 pm

About the Film:

This film gives viewers a stimulating glance into the big, bold and beautiful engineering masterpieces of Iran throughout 5000 years of its history. It is skillfully enhanced by exquisite images and filled with limpid quotations by renowned scholars. It truly comes alive with state-of-the-art computer-generated reconstructions of Iranian heritage in science and technology. The movie demonstrates not only the range but also the skill and virtuosity of the Iranian engineers.

About the Writer, Director, and Producer, Dr. Farzin Rezaeian:
 
Dr. Farzin Rezaeian is a world-renowned writer, director, and producer who has generated multiple works on Iran's civilization and arts. During the past 20 years, he has worked on research, compiling texts and directing documentary movies, some of which have been recognized by national and international awards.

This event is co-sponsored by Hamid and Christina Moghadam Program in Iranian Studies, Amercian Institute of Archaeology, Persian Student Association at Stanford and the Alumni Association of College of Engineering, University of Tehran.

1063370117091551.description:
The tradition of observing Domestic Violence Awareness Month in October started way back in 1987. This year, Bruin Consent Coalition has planned some exciting events to devote to this important month. Check them out below and stay tuned for updates!

Week 1: 
#LoveIs @ SWC Presents: WELL-Fair
When: Monday, October 3rd from 10-4PM 
Where: Bruin Plaza
Why: Join BCC as a part of USAC Student Wellness Commission (SWC)'s commission wide event and write what your definition of #LoveIs and participate in a potential video campaign on healthy relationships.

Domestic Violence 101 with Center for the Pacific Asian Family
When: Monday, October 3rd from 6:30-8PM
Where: Dodd 78
Why: Bruin Consent Coalition will be inviting a speaker from the Center for the Pacific Asian Family, which is a non-profit organization dedicated to supporting survivors of domestic violence and their families in the Asian Pacific Islander communities. The speaker will give an overview of domestic violence and discuss resources and ways to support survivors.

Week 2: 

CARE Certificate Training (Part 1)
When: Thursday, October 13th from 5-9PM
Where: CAPS Large Conference Room
Why: This 11-hour sexual assault, dating and domestic violence, and stalking training is offered to committed student leaders who are interested in preventing gender-based violence in the UCLA community. Email CAREadmin@caps.ucla.edu for more details and RSVP link. **Must attend all 3 dates to complete certification training

Week 3:

Sexual Assault in the Muslim Community with Al-Talib Newsmagazine
When: Wednesday, October 19th from 5:30-7PM
Where: Kerckhoff 131, 133, 135
Why: Bruin Consent Coalition will be co-hosting Sexual Assault in the Muslim Community with Al-Talib Newsmagazine, UCLA's Muslim newsmagazine. We will be inviting a speaker from The HEART Women & Girls Project, an organization that promotes sexual health and awareness on sexual violence in faith-based communities. The speaker will be talking about the barriers that survivors from the Muslim community face, such as Islamophobia, as well as statistics and resources. This will be followed with an engaging discussion with the different student groups that attend

CARE Certificate Training (Part 2)
When: Thursday, October 20th from 5-9PM
Where: CAPS Large Conference Room

Week 4: 

CARE Certificate Training (Part 3)
When: Thursday, October 27th from 5-9PM
Where: CAPS Large Conference Room

ALL MONTH: 

We will be accepting bathroom toiletries donations at any of our events or at the SWC office in Kerckhoff 308. We will be partnering with Center for the Pacific Asian Family who hope to focus on making their survivors feel more at home. Over 90% of homeless women experience domestic violence or sexual abuse in their lifetime. About 60% of women report domestic violence as the primary cause of homelessness. And almost 50% of cities report domestic violence as the primary cause of homelessness. We are looking for: loofahs, lotion, body wash, shampoo, conditioner, etc...

SPECIAL THANKS TO: The CARE Office, Center for the Pacific Asian Family, Al-Talib Newsmagazine, USAC Student Wellness Commission (SWC)

986250691493504.description:
Brazil Week – 2016

Translados and Translations Between Brazil and Hispano-América

After our 13th installment of Brazil Week and a successful inaugural Luso Week, highlighting the sounds of the Lusophone world, this year we focus our attention on the dialogues and displacements between Brazil and Spanish-speaking nations in the Americas. The conference is intended to bring together undergraduate and graduate students, translators, linguists, and scholars interested in bridging Hispanic and Lusophone cultures. Our goal is to promote scholarly discussions on the expansive array of art, literary, and cultural practices crossed by movement and migration between Brazil and Hispanic America. We will convene for two days of academic and cultural activities that include panels, workshops, music, cultural programming, and keynote addresses.

586523361497323.loc_name: Top of the Mountain Opening Concert mit Pur
586523361497323.description:
PUR im Abenteuerland Ischgl

Beim Top of the Mountain Concert am 26. November 2016 startet die deutsche Band PUR mit den Wintersportlern in die neue Skisaison. Der Eintritt ist im Skipasspreis inkludiert
„Hör gut zu“: Die laufende Saison ist noch nicht beendet, aber Ischgl hat bereits abenteuerliche Nachrichten. Am 26. November 2016 eröffnen PUR beim legendären Top of the Mountain Concert die Skisaison in Ischgl. Wenn Sänger Hartmut Engler mit seinen sechs Bandkollegen die größten Hits ihrer Geschichte wie „Funkelperlenaugen“, „Ich lieb’ dich“ und Songs vom aktuellen Album „Achtung“ anspielt, herrscht in der Alpen-Lifestyle-Metropole Stimmung PUR. Das Live-Konzert vor der Bergkulisse der Silvretta startet um 18 Uhr. Tagsüber geht es für Wintersportler ins Abenteu-erland: Mit Beginn der Skisaison öffnet Ischgl seine 238 Pistenkilometer von Österreich bis in die Schweiz. Der Skipass ist gleichzeitig die Eintrittskarte zum Konzert und kostet für einen Tag 65,00 Euro pro Person. Skipässe ab zwei Tagen sind zum Normaltarif erhältlich und berechtigen zum Besuch des Konzertes.

Deutsche Popgeschichte spielt in Ischgl
Aus der Schülerband Crusade wird Opus. Aus der Studentenband Opus wird PUR. Und mit PUR wird deutsche Popgeschichte geschrieben. Als die Band 1975 im Keller einer Kirchengemeinde gegründet wird, ahnt wohl keiner der Mitglieder, dass sie einmal zu den erfolgreichsten Bands in Deutschland gehören werden. 1990 landen sie ihren ersten Hit „Lena“ und sind seitdem fester Bestandteil der deutschen Charts. Neben ihrer musikalischen Leistungen sind die sechs Bandmitglieder rund um Frontmann Hartmut Engler für ihre kreativen Kostüme und spektakulären Live-Shows bekannt. Gemischt mit einer gigantischen Bergkulisse verspricht das PUR-Konzert am 26. November 2016 in Ischgl einen ganz besonderen Saisonauftakt 2016/17.

1731442527127715.description:
London’s new attraction, the Slide at the ArcelorMittal Orbit is coming to the Park this summer! Measuring 178m, the Slide will be the world’s tallest and longest slide. 

Opening on 24 June, the Slide will be open daily, you’ll be able to travel down the UK’s tallest public artwork through light and dark sections as London’s dramatic skyscape passes by. The Slide will twist and turn 12 times and then it will end with a 50 metre straight run to the ground. In the exhilarating 40-second trip, riders are expected to hit speeds of up to 15 miles per hour!

Tickets will sell out quickly, so don’t miss out. For more information about tickets please visit the ArcelorMittal Orbit website http://arcelormittalorbit.com/

PERFORMANCES: 
Friday, October 21st, 5:30 PM
Saturday, October 22nd, 4:00 PM
Sunday, October 23rd, 4:00 PM
Friday, October 28th, 5:30 PM 
Sunday, October 30th, 4:00 PM

TICKETS: Premium Seating: $72 ($52 for Stanford faculty/staff/students with valid ID)
Regular Seating: $52 ($32 for Stanford faculty/staff/students with valid ID)

LOCATION: Visual and Performing Arts Center at De Anza College (read below for parking permit instructions) 

DESCRIPTION: A hadji sets out to sell his servant and buy in his place a young slave girl. On the way, they see a poet about to be beheaded; a young lover in search of a purloined beloved; and troubadours, their profession banned, desperate to bring joy and laughter to any face. In short, the world they see is all topsy-turvy.

Tarabnameh has its genealogy in the tradition of Takhte-Hozi plays—a tradition of popular plays, combining comedy and music, dance and poetry. Centuries of despotism have rendered this form bereft of content. In Tarabnameh, a play with a cast of thirty-seven actors, this ancient comic genre keeps its joyous ambiance but takes on new form and meaning, underscoring the possibilities of once forgotten traditions becoming rich, robust, and lively modern forms of theater.

This play is written and directed acclaimed Iranian playwright Bahram Beyzaie. The play is being performed in Persian. Only part 2 of this play is being performed. A written account of part 1 by Mr. Beyzaie will be available at Iranian-studies.stanford.edu shortly.

We are very pleased to announce that the acclaimed actress Shabnam Tolouei will be joining the cast of Tarabnameh for part 2!

Please note the run time for this performance is approximately 5 ½ hours which includes a 15 and a 30-minute intermission. Concessions will be available for purchase during intermission.

IMPORTANT: Iranian Studies is covering the cost of parking for Tarabnameh attendees at De Anza’s VPAC theater! Please visit the Will Call office at the theater after you park to get a pass for your car. If you do not get a pass from Will Call or do not purchase a pass from De Anza, you might get a parking ticket and Iranian Studies cannot be held responsible for this.

Sponsored by the Hamid and Christina Moghadam Program in Iranian Studies and the Stanford Festival of Iranian Arts.

Seating for this event is Reserved.

Tickets will not be available in person. Online sales will remain open up to one hour after the performance has begun.

1073822852739321.description:
*** NOTE *** This event was not created by anyone responsible for or affiliated with Princeton Garden Theatre. The purpose of this event is to publicize the Mohammad Assaf biopic "The Idol" by Palestinian director Hany Abu-Assad, Oscar-nominated director of "Omar," one of the best thriller film of all time, full stop.

*** Showtime for Thursday, 1 December 2016 ***
5:30 p.m.

*** SYNOPSIS ***
Gaza. Synonymous to so many with conflict, destruction and despair but to Mohammed Assaf, and his sister Nour, Gaza is their home and their playground. It’s where they, along with their best friends Ahmad and Omar, play music, football and dare to dream big. Their band might play on second hand, beaten up instruments but their ambitions are sky-high. For Mohammed and Nour, nothing less than playing the world famous Cairo Opera Hall will do. It might take them a lifetime to get there but, as Mohammed will find out, some dreams are worth living for.

Along the way, Mohammed will experience tragedy and loss. The world around him will shatter. Through it all, however, he will somehow retain the hope that his voice will somehow deliver him from the pain that surrounds him and bring joy to others. He sings at weddings, he drives a taxi to pay for his university studies. Even as the siege around Gaza intensifies, the prison around them ever more forbidding, Mohammed knows he has a rare gift. To make people smile and forget their troubles.

And so, in front of him on TV one evening lies an impossible dream: the auditions for Arab Idol, the most popular show in the Arab world, are taking place in Cairo. The borders are closed. There is no way out. Somehow, he finds a way and makes it in front of the judges in Egypt. From there, destiny awaits, a chance to change his life and give a voiceless people the greatest feeling of all: the freedom to love, live and feel free.

*** Director ***
Hany Abu-Assad (Oscar nominee "Paradise Now" and "Omar")

*** Writer ***
Sameh Zoabi (Director of "Man Without a Cell Phone")

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Part of the Princeton International Cinema Series, a collaboration of the Princeton Public Library, the International Employees Group at Princeton University, the Davis International Center and the Princeton Garden Theatre.

1226685477383466.description:
We love a good midnight screening here at the Arts Picturehouse!  Fantastic Beasts And Where To Find Them is an all-new adventure returning us to the wizarding world created by J.K. Rowling. 

Academy Award winner Eddie Redmayne ( The Theory of Everything Movie) stars in the central role of wizarding world magizoologist Newt Scamander, under the direction of David Yates, who helmed the last four Harry Potter blockbusters. 

Fantastic Beasts And Where To Find Them opens in 1926 as Newt Scamander has just completed a global excursion to find and document an extraordinary array of magical creatures. Arriving in New York for a brief stopover, he might have come and gone without incident were it not for a No-Maj (American for Muggle) named Jacob, a misplaced magical case, and the escape of some of Newt’s fantastic beasts, which could spell trouble for both the wizarding and No-Maj worlds.

547466705410796.description:
Die Stadt Blankenberg erstrahlt erneut im November für ein Wochenende in historischem Schein.
Mit der historischen Katharinenkirmes zu Stadt Blankenberg vom 18. – 20.11.2016 drehen die Veranstalter Zarorien e.V. und die Karnevalsfreunde zu Stadt Blankenberg zum nunmehr 14. Male die Zeit in der kleinsten Stadt Deutschlands zurück in das Jahr 1248. An allen drei Tagen können die Besucher wieder auf Zeitreise gehen und das Mittelalter mit allen fünf Sinnen erleben.

Der Markt öffnet am Freitag gegen 16:00 Uhr seine Tore und dauert offiziell bis 22:00 Uhr. Am Samstag beginnt das Spektakel gegen 10:00 Uhr und endet gegen 22:00 Uhr. Am Sonntag haben Besucher von 10:00 Uhr bis 18:00 Uhr Gelegenheit, den Markt zu erkunden. Es wird empfohlen, öffentliche Verkehrsmittel zur Anreise zu nutzen. Ein Shuttelbus-Service erleichtert den steilen Weg zur Burg.

Are you someone who somehow feel lost in your life and confused for what you really want to do and who you really are? Are you one of those who feels stuck of doing something that you don't wanna do? Or, are you one of those broken hearted and lost and trying to search for your soul? Or are you someone who have a stagnant life and wants to take it to the next level? We all have different situations in life that is hard to handle. We all have something heavy to carry in our hearts. And that's why DLC Enterprise is here. At DLC Enterprise, we are a family. And we are going to help you answer your life questions and share with you some of the most precious life secrets... 1766132916943681.loc_name: Harvard Arab Weekend 2016: Beyond the Present
1766132916943681.description:
Harvard Arab Weekend (HAW) is the largest pan-Arab conference in North America, bringing together nearly 1,300 students and professionals to discuss key issues with the region’s most prominent politicians, business people, and civil society leaders. HAW has prided itself on showcasing a mosaic of perspectives and insights on the most pressing issues in the Arab world. In 2011, HAW was commended by the White House as “the premier Arab world conference” in North America.
 HAW 2016 Theme: "Beyond the present; striving towards a brighter future"
Hope for a brighter future is the fuel of the Arab world. Every generation hopes to be an agent of change, and if anyone is going to make a difference or change, it must be us. This is what HAW 2016 is all about.
This theme of Beyond the Present will allow us, through action, to move beyond the current acknowledged reality, beyond the binary concepts of turbulence and stability; peace and war; rise and fall, towards a light of another, better, reality that will be up to our generation to create. 
Too often, change is unforeseen; a concept unlocked from monolithic notions of oppression and injustice, dictatorship and democracy, or better and worse. We must have agency in our destiny. This idea will be explored in all its dimensions and aspects; humanitarian, political, economic, health, social, educational, cultural, technological, artistic, media and much more. 
This future must encompass the ethos of the countries involved, in addition to understanding the links between them, embracing different cultures, as well as Western and Eastern civilizations with all their under-girding constituents.
At this decade mark, our theme will allow us to examine the act of striving, and the aspirations of the region's youth to channel their energy towards building the future for the Arab World, beyond its present. In which, the younger generation has so much hope. The younger generation who is the fuel of change. The younger generation who is our generation. The younger generation who is us- the HAW 2016.

We look forward to seeing you in November!
 
Warm regards,
Leen Al Kassab and Abdulaziz AlBassam

P.S, Please check our website www.HarvardArabweekend.com or downloand our app Harvard Arab Weekend 2016 for further infromation on the schadule and specific locations.

FInd us on : https://www.facebook.com/ArabWeekendHarvard/ for frequent updates

1532062217033380.description:

30. April - Tanz in den Mai im La Macumba, dem Treffpunkt für alle norddeutschen Latinos, Salseros und solche, die es noch werden möchten.

Die einfallsreichsten Cocktails, die heissesten Latino-Rhythmen und die wohl besten Salsataenzer - zum Fruehlingsanfang die Caribik live erleben im ansonsten kühlen Norden!

Eingeladen sind alle, die Lust an heisser Salsa, an Bachata, Merengue und Reggaeton haben. Um 22:00 Uhr geht es los.


Wer dann genauso tanzen moechte, wie an diesem Abend gesehen, am 01. Juni beginnt die nächste Kursstaffel an der Latin Dance Academy - http://lda.in/index.php?arg=KURSinfo_neu

Und natürlich jedes Wochenende Workshop zu den verschiedensten Themen der cubanischen Tänze. - http://lda.in/index.php?arg=PROGRAMM#ws


Professionelle Trainer - alle mit abgeschlossenem Studium an der ISA - der cubanischen nationalen Kunsthochschule fuer Taenzer, Choreographen und Tanzpaedagogen - bringen auch dem *steifsten* Norddeutschen caribisches Koerperbewusstsein nahe.


Erst einmal aber viel Spass allen, die mit ihren Freunden dabeisein koennen, viel Spass in der langen Nacht von April auf Mai in der Hamburger Innenstadt.

205918389765112.description:
███████████████████████

FM4 Indiekiste mit Placebo
’20 Years of Placebo’ 
Support: The Joy Formidable
13.11.2016, Wiener Stadthalle 

███████████████████████

Placebo will be heading out on a world tour in October to celebrate the 20th Anniversary of the release of their platinum selling debut album ’Placebo’. 

The first leg of the ’20 Years of Placebo’ tour kicks off in Denmark on October 13th 2016 and runs through to Wembley Arena in London on December 15th 2016.  Further dates for 2017 will be revealed later.

The Band Promise a set list spanning their whole back catalogue. Brian Molko teased…

“Let's just say there will be songs in the set that I've sworn never to play again. I think it's time that we purposefully acknowledged what a lot of Placebo fans really want to hear. They've been very patient with us since we rarely play our most commercially successful material.  A 20 year anniversary tour seems like the right time to do so. That's our intention. This tour is very much for the fans and a chance for us to revisit a lot of our early material. So, if you want to see us play songs like 'Pure Morning’ and 'Nancy Boy’ which we haven't played in almost ten years and may not play again, then you'd better come along to these shows! We'll have some surprises in there too."

192490431166226.loc_name: 1. Mosbacher Streetfood Festival mit Craft Beer und Weinfest !
192490431166226.description:
Street Food – Schon oft gehört und jetzt auch in Mosbach !

Eigentlich beherrscht Street Food längst unseren Alltag. In dieser schnelllebigen Zeit ist es nicht mehr weg zu denken – Asia-nudeln to go, schnell ein belegtes Sandwich für Unterwegs oder der Döner um die Ecke für kochfaule. Street Food ist eine Spezialität, die typisch für ein bestimmtes Land oder eine Region ist. Vor allem in Asien und Afrika ist Street Food Teil der Kultur. Und das holen wir jetzt auch zu uns.

Die Gastronomen legen sich für Sie so richtig ins Zeug. Kulinarische Gaumenfreuden aus aller Welt lassen einem das Wasser im Mund zusammenlaufen. Direkt vor den Augen der Besucher zubereitet, unkompliziert und auf die Hand verkauft bieten Food Trucks und Food-Buden allerhand Geschmackserlebnisse für Groß und Klein. Entdecken Sie die Küchen der Welt, probieren Sie Neues und lassen Sie sich inspirieren von exotischen Gerichten, außergewöhnlichen Traditionen und Getränken in allen möglichen Varianten. Kombiniert wird die Veranstaltung mit einem Weindorf, zur Jahreszeit passend.

Wo gefeiert wird darf Musik nicht fehlen. Freitagabend ab 20.00Uhr unterhält Ashley Whited mit Franky Rogers bis 23.00Uhr die Besucher. Ein einmaliges Schlemmer- und Unterhaltungserlebnis.

Die Streetfood Festival Tour von Eventtime zieht das komplette Jahr 2017 durch Städte der Region Nordbaden/Nordbayern

Die Termine findet ihr auf der Webseite:  http://www.eventtime-streetfood-festival.de

Wir freuen uns auf viele Besucher

Edwartainments & Cambridge Junction proudly present 
THE MOUSE OUTFIT

Friday 2nd December 2016 
Cambridge Junction, Clifton Way, Cambridge Leisure Park, CB1 7GX, UK

▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀

The Mouse Outfit is a 9 piece live band and production team centred around Chini (keys), Pitch (percussion/MPC) and Defty (bass). Their acclaimed debut album won UK hip hop album of the year 2013 (Wordplay Magazine) and was ranked in ABC News’ top 50 albums of 2013. Since the release of ‘Escape Music’ (which is now available on double vinyl through HHV.DE), their profile has increased significantly, both within the UK and internationally. The album featured many of Manchester’s most talented MCs, but the live show is fronted by UK hip hop legend Dr Syntax and verbal acrobat Sparkz. A horn heavy and funk driven live show combines original material with medleys of classic hip hop and bboy breaks, which has lead the band to be a firm favourite at festivals and clubs throughout the UK.

Earlier in their career they built a loyal fan base supporting many of the world’s finest hip hop acts including Chali 2na, Souls Of Mischief, Akil the MC and The Sugarhill Gang. Their reputation as a high quality live act resulted in two invitations to perform at the BBC’s legendary Maida Vale Studios in London. 2014 saw the band take their brand of funk, jazz and reggae influenced hip hop to France, Germany, Italy, Hungary, Czech Republic and Croatia, with key slots at prestigious festivals such as Soundwave, Outlook and Fusion.

938616686162633.loc_name: Participate in the Sing'n'Joy Princeton 2017  The American International Choral Festival
938616686162633.description:
February 16-20, 2017 | Princeton (NJ), USA

After the spectacular success of the 2012 World Choir Games in Cincinnati, INTERKULTUR is now working to spread this enthusiasm to other destinations within the United States. In 2017, the choirs of the world will sing together in Princeton, New Jersey, for the Grand Prize of this SING'N'JOY event.

From the vibrant megacity of New York it will take you less than two hours on the South highway to reach the placid town of Princeton. What is more, Princeton has a worldwide reputation for being  the location of Princeton University, which has been part of the community since 1756.

The city is also well known in the choral world as the home of the Westminster Choir College, one of the world's leading schools of music. Therefore, it seemed more than natural for INTERKULTUR and Westminster Choir College to step into a cooperation and organize together a choral festival in Princeton.

Bearing the slogan “Singing and Joy”, the Sing'n'Joy Princeton will be taking place from February 16 to 19, 2017. The Sing'n'Joy concept also includes concerts and manifold encounters between the participating choirs. The competitions will be taking place in the Princeton High School Center of Performing Arts and Westminster Choir College will open their Chapel for the “Musica Sacra” category and for concerts. One of the highlights of the event will be ensembles from Westminster Choir College who will present their world class quality in the Grand Opening and maybe also on other occasions during the festival.

Conductors and Singers will be given the chance to attend master classes held by Morten Lauridsen and other choral experts and why not enjoy the beauty of New Jersey, the so called “Garden State”, with its 127 miles of coastline on the Atlantic Ocean, more than 800 lakes and ponds, 36 state parks, 24 historic sites and much more.

On Monday, February 20, which will mark the President´s Day in 2017, an official holiday, the choirs will have the opportunity to visit New York and even to sing there … but that shall remain a secret at the present time … stay tuned to learn more about it soon.

Princeton & New York – what more can you offer to your choir for an attractive and successful concert tour? Come and join INTERKULTUR in New Jersey, The Garden State, and celebrate with us this international festival of choral music in Princeton!

1232493353449349.description:
Now in its’ fifth year, this popular event brought to you by the Stanford Wine Route raises funds for the Butterfly Foundation and thereby the Butterfly Centre in Stanford. NPO Number168-212
Read more about the centre and its’ ideals on the attached letter. 

The Stanford Stumble is an awesome day out for the whole family, and entails a gentle meander (or a run, if you are that way inclined) through the vineyards, with teams encouraged to dress in their most outrageous outfits. 

What makes for even more fun is the fact that traditional water stops are replaced by wine stations enroute, and many new friendships have been forged along the way. We are grateful to have the support of the Stanford Wine Route, ensuring that participants can sample some of the fine wines available from this area. 

The race will be started by Alissa Coetzee, our Miss Teen Commonwealth SA finalist and supporter of the Butterfly Centre. Her efforts in 2016 already raised over R40 000 for the cause!

After the race there is a variety of local live music, food, face painting and a cash bar. The venue is fantastic for children, with its’ jungle gym, trampoline, and rowboats on the dam.

This year there will be a spit braai for R100 per adult, and all proceeds from this will also be for the Butterfly Centre. 

Registration is from 3pm, race starts 4pm. After the race we will hold a short auction as well as judging and prizes before the full festivities kick off. This includes a prize for best Movember mo, best dressed and best team spirit. 

Entry fees are R100 per adult and R50 per child, special rates for larger teams. 

See a movie of the 2014 event here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1DOKtwuUGl4 

The race entry fees, auction income, full income from the spit braai and a portion of drink sales are for charity, in the name of the Butterfly Foundation. 100% of the funds raised this year will be handed to the Butterfly Centre,  a wonderful institution catering to the needs of special needs children, and ensuring that these kids are able to learn to their full potential in a happy environment filled with love and laughter. 
Please join us for a fun day out, for a very good cause. Further info 028 341 0841.
